Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Vines from a single four-acre parcel that are between 80 and 100 years in age make up this wood-aged wine. These old vines add to the dense structure and richness of the black fruits. This wine is full of promise and aging potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Haute Olive 2018 Les Cornuelles  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This producer based just east of the city of Chinon has made a rich wine. Packed with dark fruits and youthful vitality, the wine is dense and perfumed. The texture and acidity go with the bold fruits to give a wine for aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2019 Thélème  (Chinon)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of graphite, cedar and cassis lead the nose on this 100% Cabernet Franc, along with whiffs of dark spice. Enveloping and generous, the full-bodied, concentrated palate also shows finesse, offering baked plum, blackberry jam and mocha framed in tightly knit, velvety tannins. Drink 2023–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2018 Campo Magnacosta Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is Cab Franc at its zestiest, laden with pyrazine-powered aromas of green peppercorn and pasilla chile atop the snappy red fruit of underripe raspberry. The texture is tremendously taut, gripping the earthy and herbal flavors of moss, bay leaf and pine needle while the cran-raspberry-juice core keeps on refreshing.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Halcyon 2019 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The Sourdais family is well established in Chinon and the seventh generation now works at this estate. From specific parcels of old vines, this wine is textured, dense and concentrated. Its rich structure is balanced by black fruits and an edge of acidity. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Haute Olive 2019 Les Clos  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is well textured, complex and spicy from wood aging. Layers of black fruits, rich tannins and perfumes have knit together into a dense, concentrated wine that's ready to drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2017 Clos de l'Echo  (Chinon)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Camphor, graphite, leather and grilled herb aromas mingle with a whiff of blue flowers. Made entirely with Cabernet Franc, the bold, concentrated palate offers mouthfuls of raspberry jam, espresso, molten chocolate and licorice framed in enveloping tannins. While it carries its high alcohol content well, the 16% abv catches up with you.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2018 Campo Tenaglia Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Pure varietal, aged in one-quarter new French oak, and given extra bottle age prior to release, this is softer and smoother than younger vintages of this grape, to its benefit. Ripe plum and cherry fruit is swathed in svelte tannins and accented with scents and highlights of cocoa and coffee. There's a teasing whiff of tobacco threading through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2015 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich wine is now smooth, with the structure and black-fruit flavors well integrated into a velvet texture. Wood aging shows in the extra ripeness of this wine that is just ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2017 Les Coutures  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wood-aged wine is still firm, its tannins and structure still developing. It comes from old vines planted on the slope above the village of Saint-Nicolas. The textured wine will be richly ready to drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2017 Les Racines Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Sorel was the official mistress of French King Charles VII (vineyards are close to her Château de Loches) This wine is well structured, with generous, classic rich tannins and smoky flavors. Black-currant fruits and perfumes abound. Still young, the wine will be at its best from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2018 Cuvée Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: From wood aging, this spicy, ripe wine has structure that will allow it age. Rich blackberry fruits are lifted by the acidity and dry core. Drink this rich, ageworthy wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2019 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh cranberry, white pepper, carnation and wild thyme show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from just one barrel. It's fresh and zesty on the palate, where rounded strawberry and cherry flavors are dusted with cracked pepper and sprigs of marjoram.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Halcyon 2019 Ascona Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: The nose is initially shy but eventually reveals aromas suggesting leather, cedar, Mediterranean brush and espresso. The firm, full-bodied palate shows the heat of the vintage, offering dried blackberry, roasted coffee bean, licorice and grilled sage. Compact, close-grained tannins grip the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Macchiole 2017 Paleo Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Now with a seventh generation involved, this family estate owns vines just east of Chinon. With its structure and density, this wood-aged wine has concentration and power. The black fruits are still a little behind the structure but are developing well. The wine should be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Haute Olive 2019 Le Chêne Vert  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: In this rich, wood-aged wine, ripe berry fruits are balanced by a complex structure for a ripe medley of flavors. The wine is just beginning to hint of a comfortable maturity, with tannins melting into the autumnal flavors. Drink the wine from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2016 Baronnie Madeleine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Generous, even joyous aromas of black plum are hemmed in by wood spice, dried peppercorns and a savory, umami-laden sense of shiitake on the nose of this bottling. It's quite savory on the palate as well, where blackberry and black-plum flavors are wrapped in a leathery texture with hints of mahogany and soy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lexington 2016 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is smooth, with solid fruits and spice from wood aging. It has richness and potential. The perfumed texture and black-currant fruits are heading for a ripe, full maturity. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2019 Les Marguerites La Contrie  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: With six months in wood, this wine now has perfumed maturity and a smooth texture. Ripe tannins have melded into the black-currant and red-berry fruits, lifted by acidity at the end. Drink the wine now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2017 La Seigneurie Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Aged in wood, this smoothly texture, perfumed wine is ripe, balanced and fruity. A core of tannins holds the liveliness of the wine together. Drink this attractive wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Commanderie 2018 Tradition  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Classic ripe, red-fruit Cabernet Franc, this wine comes from just east of the fortress city of Chinon. It is richly textured and full in the mouth, with touches of vanilla and spice combining with the fruits. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Haute Olive 2019  Chinon

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Ripe red fruits combine with fresh acidity in this still-young wine. Produced from old vines, the structured wine has a smoky edge.Perfumed and packed with fruit, it will be at its best from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2018 Les Rouillères  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur Puy-Notre-Dame, Loire Valley, France
Description: South of the Loire-side city of Saumur, this estate has produced a ripe, spicy wine with a light texture over smoky flavors and generous red fruits. The wine still vibrates with young fruit, so let it settle and drink from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de l'Enchantoir 2018 Le Pied à l'Etrier  (Saumur Puy-Notre-Dame)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is all about rich Cabernet Franc, spicy and full of berry flavors. Strongly perfumed and with a smoky edge, the wine is ripe and still young with tannins. Wait for it to soften and drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Les Gravières d'Amador Abbé de Turpenay
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2018 Les Gravières d'Amador Abbé de Turpenay  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: The estate situated on the banks of the Loire east of the city of Saumur has produced this ripe, spicy wine from old vines. It is still young, with blackberry fruits and a smoky richness. Look to this wine achieving its potential from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Villeneuve 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich, wood-aged wine comes from old vines. It offers ripeness, tannins that will soften well and excellent potential. The richness is a sign of the vintage, giving the wine a dense texture. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Varenne 2019 Les Pierres Blanches  (Chinon)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This beautiful and muscular wine matches deep, focused blueberry and black-currant flavors with mouthcoating, fine-grained tannins for good balance on a high level. With 15% Petit Verdot blended in, it offers good depth, layered fruit, accents of espresso and vanilla and a creamy mouthfeel despite the saturated tannins. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2018 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lussac Saint-Émilion, Bordeaux, France
Description: Centenarian vine Cabernet Franc aged for a year in an amphora has yielded a well-structured wine. Dense tannins are no impediment to the wine's black fruits and spicy, open character. Rich and concentrated, the wine will age and be best from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château des Landes 2018 Luccianus Amphore  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Graphite minerality meets with blackberry and dark-currant aromas on the nose of this bottling, which shows both the ripe and herbal side of Cabernet Franc. Hearty black-raspberry and cherry flavors are offset by cracked pepper, light herbs and a touch of peppermint toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dracaena 2018 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of raspberry, whole Satsuma orange, dried herb and smoke with whiffs of black olive. The palate dances lightly, soft, bright and seamless. It's a very pretty expression of the variety, with lovely depth and texture. Pair it with grilled eggplant ratatouille.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Two Blondes Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a one-of-a-kind wine, carbonic macerated from one of the state's top vineyards. There are upfront aromas of green pepper, peat, cranberry, pomegranate and strawberry. Light, bright flavors follow, with an intriguing, grainy, almost tacky feel. Food required. Pair it with grilled flank steak with chimichurri.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Cru Carbonic Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Flavorful, fresh and well balanced, this full-bodied wine is easy to enjoy for its expressive cherry and spiced-plum flavors, rounded tannins and mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cinnabar 2017 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The cherry aromas announce themselves, along with a dusting of baking chocolate and dried herbs subsequently speaking up. The flavors display grace and polish. It's a pretty expression of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2018 Foundation Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all varietal from this esteemed vineyard. Aromas of dried leaves, crab apple, smoke and raspberry lead to a bunched up palate that expands over time. It has plenty of sneaky subtleties. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Avennia 2018 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling begins with aromas of snappy cranberry, carnation, light pepper and a touch of leather on the nose. Damp wood, iodine and mushroom flavors arise on the sip, where the fresh cranberry core is cut by crushed peppercorns.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very flavorful and concentrated, this full-bodied wine combines dark chocolate, cherry and hints of herbs and black pepper for a sense of complexity that's nicely supported by moderate tannins. Good balance makes it easy to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dante Robere 2018 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of chocolate-covered cherries and dried herbs are followed by a rich, flavorful palate, with undulating dark fruit and chocolate flavors. There are plenty of spice accents throughout. Lightly grainy tannins back this high octane wine up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2018 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of vanilla, caramel and baked black currant meet with a light dusting of pepper and baking spice on the nose of this bottling. The toasty aspect is strong on the palate, where black cherry, cola and mocha are framed by slightly tense tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2018 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding aromas of cocoa powder, raspberry and cherry lead to somewhat lighter-styled flavors. It's reserved, with pleasing balance throughout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2018 Piloti Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are still locked up at present, with speckles of spice, cedar and cherry poking through. The palate is all about restraint and nuance. It's equal parts promise and delivery. Best after 2022.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2018 Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an inaugural rosé from this producer, with the fruit coming from Stoneridge Vineyard. Pale salmon in color, with aromas of strawberry and wet rock leading to broader feeling fruit flavors with plenty of acidity to stand them up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Virtue 2019 Tranquility Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh black-raspberry aromas meet with lavender and a bit of baked plum on the nose of this bottling. There is an iron-rich minerality to the sip, where dark-berry flavors mesh into the rusty elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Big Dog 2017 Cabernet Franc (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Half of this wine comes from Elephant Mountain Vineyard with the other half from Dineen. Coffee and cherry aromas dominate. The coffee flavors are sumptuous but still dance lightly, trailing toward the finish. It seems a bit one note, but that note is interesting.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 2017 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This focused, serious wine offers concentrated black-cherry and cranberry flavors, firm tannins and a medium to full body. It's holding its flavors tightly though, so best to drink after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2018 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the Royal Slope region, the aromas offer notes of clove and apple with whiffs of golden raisin. The fruit seems a bit dried out and the tannins bunched up. It's hard to see where it's all going.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Baer 2017 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas include a note of animal fur. This Cab Franc is easy on the palate, with an honest structure and tannic grip. Berry and plum flavors are blue-green in the middle, while this finishes with peppery spice notes, minty oak and lasting tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Garzón 2019 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Light earthy, vanillin aromas lead to mild, mature red-fruit flavors and an herbal accent in this smooth and lightly tannic wine. It offers some subtle complexity that is fun to experience.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Miller Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Lamorinda, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A flint and matchstick aroma and tight black-fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine a stiff profile, underscored by firm tannins and a drying mouthfeel. It may just need more time to come around. Best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meadow View 2018 Isabelle's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Lamorinda)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an earthy interpretation of this wonderful grape from a well-respected site better known for Cabernet Sauvignon. Cedar, dried herb, black olive and cocoa powder highlight a hearty frame of supple red fruit, crushed rock and dark chocolate, finishing in a bold tannic structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Justice 2018 Frontier Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It would be easy to mistake this herbally complex, texturally taut and tantalizingly fresh Cabernet Franc for a Loire Valley bottling, which is the inspiration. Aromas of just-ripe boysenberry, green tobacco and wet rocks lead into a tightly woven palate full of crunchy cranberry, chaparral shrubs and lingering carnation. Beware: bottle empties easily.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lieu Dit 2019 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Great complexity, luscious fruit flavors and a firm but polished texture give this full-bodied wine everything it needs for enjoyment now and for several years to come. Black cherries, black olives, tobacco and clove mingle on a fabric of fine-grained tannins for a luxurious and savory palate. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2016 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: An impressive version of the variety, this wine is thick in black cherry and mocha flavors. The tannins are supple and elongated, adding complexity and structure to the juicy richness that is accented by toasted oak and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2018 4 Barrels Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This tightly woven wine is on the way to maturity but still holding its abundant black-cherry, black-pepper and olive flavors firmly in masses of fine-grained tannins. Light toasted oak and mint aromas segue into the savory, deep fruit flavors and linger on the finish. It's a library release made from ungrafted, high-elevation vines. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lang & Reed 2010 Franc de Pied Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This deep and robust wine combines power with complexity, offering fragrant black-currant and tobacco aromas, and rich blackberry flavors with a hint of dark chocolate. Firm, fine-grained tannins give it a lip-smacking texture that bodes well for aging. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling smells of cherry-soaked pork roasted with mushrooms over a smoldering oak fire. The palate aligns with that, offering shiitake, dried cherry and beefy charcuterie flavors—an altogether savory and well-integrated expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2017 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a slightly denser take on the grape, beginning with smoke, baked cherry, sarsaparilla and vanilla cream on the nose, with a crushed graphite minerality lingering in the backdrop. Fairly tight tannins wrap up the sip, where smoked cherry, red plum, marjoram and bay leaf make for a complex expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brick Barn 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: This is juicy and substantial red wine, the tannins thick and foundational. Oak, dried herb and richly layered jolts of dark cherry and cassis dominate on a long, concentrated palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Darioush 2018 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Cabernet Franc, this offers aromas of toasted oak, green bell pepper and ripe dark-skinned fruit. The dense palate features black-currant jam, clove and sage alongside grainy tannins and a tart, drying finish. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2017 Scipio Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose-petal aromas and gushing black-fruit flavors give a lot of charm to this full-bodied but fresh-feeling wine. It tastes pure and uncomplicated, simply full of enjoyment.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2018 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Fresh cranberry, raspberry and just picked violet blend together on the nose. The palate combines cranberry and goji with black tea and leather. A persistent banana pepper note tangos with the tannins. This is a high energy Cab Franc with streamlined acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Trianion Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: The nose delivers cedar and muddled raspberry with a subtle hint of rubber. The palate is rich in Virginia tobacco and cedar with a blend of black cherry and pomegranate fruit flavors. The tannins are dry and supportive, balanced by ample acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Narmada 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Madera County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smooth and easygoing wine offers dried cranberry aromas, red-currant flavors and moderate tannins that beef up the texture slightly. Light butter and vanilla notes add an oaky flair.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fasi Estate 2019 Cabernet Franc (Madera County)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Sage, dried herb and pencil shavings accent a tannic and substantial palate of ripeness and power in this earthy, full-bodied wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Oakville East 2017 Franc 'N Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of dried tobacco, dried orange rind, cherry and barrel spice. Creamy-feeling, lightly smoky flavors follow. It all seems a bit dried out.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stemilt Creek 2017 Successive Generations Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is somewhat dull on the palate, showing ripe, simple layers of red fruit and dried herb. The tannins are pushy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Park Avenue 2017 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: The aroma offers notes of cranberry and cherry while the palate delivers balsamic soaked raspberry and cherry with sharp acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Horton 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: This vibrant, cherry-hued red is a brilliantly lucid example of the variety. Bright, fresh, juicy berry fruit bounces from the glass. A white pepper note quickly follows, then come black olives, dried leaves, herbs and stalks. These aromas morph neatly into flavors on the silky palate, lingering long on the finish. There's a lovely lift of crisp acidity that keeps this in light-bodied territory.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Paritua 2017 Stone Paddock Cabernet Franc (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Burgenland, Austria
Description: The purest, ripest blueberry notes beckon from the glass. The palate comes with incredible firmness and a web of still drying but fine, ripe tannins. This is big and bold, edged with cinnamon spice and a hint of gaminess. The finish is long, drying and fresh. Drink 2025–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2017 Gillesberg Cabernet Franc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Waipara, New Zealand
Description: This is an elegant, lucid wine, with polished, plush berry fruit, pencil shavings and bundles of bay leaf and thyme. The medium weight palate is silky and sexy, with lovely fruit concentration. It's draped in savory, granular tannins that are fine and perfectly integrated.                      Christina Pickard
Name: The Boneline 2018 Amphitheatre Cabernet Franc (Waipara)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This handsome, full-bodied wine shows the sturdy, muscular aspect of Cabernet Franc in its structure of firm tannins while holding its complex graphite, tobacco, blackberry and singed herb flavors slightly in check. It opens and ripens beautifully in the glass, and will be best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lang & Reed 2016 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Lifted aromas of blackberry and cherry meld with a healthy dose of peppery spice on the nose. There's a pleasing plushness to the berry fruit on the palate, with smoothed tannins and balanced acidity providing a solid frame. Gentle accents of crushed herbs and black pepper chime in, but never detract from the solid core of cherry and bramble berry flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Harbes 2016 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp aromas of cran-raspberry, light pepper, a waft of smoke and dried carnations make for a fresh entry to the nose of this bottling, which carries the variety's typical spice quite well. There is a tantalizing freshness to the sip, where taut tannins deliver zippy flavors of raspberry, flower petals and a touch of vanilla on the back end.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2018 Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of roasted coffee bean and char are followed by pleasing dried herb accents and dark fruit notes. The flavors are ripe and soft but still sleek, with plentiful dark chocolate accents.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2017 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Dense aromas of black cherry and blackberry meld with lavender, resinous herbs and cocoa on the nose. The medium-bodied palate echos the nose, showing well-concentrated juicy berry tones framed by polished tannins and pulsing acidity. It ends lifted and racy, but with a mix of fruity, floral and bitter cocoa nuances extending on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lenz 2017 Estate Selection Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of blackberry juice and rose-petal extract tickle the nose on this reserve bottling. Lush tannins frame the sip, where baked cherry, star anise and licorice flavors are lifted by the variety's inherent freshness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brecon Estate 2018 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Ripe black plum and blackberry aromas are lightly herbal and minty. Spicy oak and mocha flavors cover a dark-fruit base on the palate, while this Cabernet Franc pulses across a finish that pulls energy from core acidity. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maquis 2017 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark fruits pack this muscular wine, streaked and layered with vanilla and espresso highlights. It's big, blocky and black-fruited, with tannins leaving a touch of black tea. One-quarter was aged in new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Griffin Creek 2017 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: The Cab Franc is a real success in this vintage, delivering ultraripe fruit that leans into flavors of figs, prunes and cherries. Aged 18 months in one-quarter new French oak, the wine has a lightly smoky, slightly chalky flavor as it trails away.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stratus 2017 Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of freshly pressed blackberry and dark cherry meld with lifted elements of black pepper, coffee and singed rosemary on the nose. There's plushness to the berry fruit on the palate, framed by a grip of tannins and lifted acidity. This solid Cabernet Franc sees 18 months in French oak.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: McCall 2014 Reserve North Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: This Hawkes Bay Cab France, made with no additions, pulses with raw energy and a rustic European table wine vibe. It's stalky, savory and dense, with notes of black olives, sap, herbs and cherries. At first sip you feel the juicy fruit, then the tannins rush in, gripping the tongue like a vice. There's an acidic lift and plenty of spice, but it's the tannins that dominate here, crying out for protein to temper them.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Amoise 2019 Cabernet Franc (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Sagrada Familia, Chile
Description: Like so many Chilean reds, this opens with herbal aromas of tobacco and eucalyptus alongside forest berry scents. A brusque palate is tannic and dry, with blackberry flavors matched by oak spice and cocoa. Dry tannins firm up a minty finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Single Vineyard Punto de Rosa Vineyard
Name: Valdivieso 2018 Single Vineyard Punto de Rosa Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sagrada Familia)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of spicy bramble berries and Mediterranean herbs carry the nose, with a shot of juicy pomegranate lifting it all up. Tart red fruit leads on the medium-bodied palate, framed by decent helpings of green herbs and peppery spice. A fine mesh of medium-grained tannins and bright acidity lend support to it all, making this a tasty, fresh Cabernet Franc.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: One Woman 2016 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Much of the fruit from this wine comes from Block 10 at this vineyard. Vanilla, tire rubber, cherry, green pepper and vegetable aromas are followed by creamy feeling fruit and barrel flavors. The aromas and palate don't quite sync up, but there is still plenty of enjoyment to be had.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Basel Cellars 2016 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Classic Chilean aromas of mint and black fruits are spicy, with a hint of oak. A linear palate is tight in feel, with brutish tannins. Dark-berry flavors are pumped full of chocolate and spice notes, while this brings buttery oak notes on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Rita 2018 Floresta Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather lean and firm, this dry and appetizing wine offers lots of dark-fruit aromas and hints of red vermouth and tamarind on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Page Mill Winery 2018 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While bursting in aromas of blackberry and cherry, there are pleasing base notes of peppery spice and crushed herbs on the nose that lend a delightful counterbalance in this wine. It's juicy and fresh on the medium-bodied palate, dealing more herbal and peppery flavors against a berry backdrop, with a mild grip of gritty tannins lending support. This is a solid Cabernet Franc to enjoy alongside a casual meal of pizza or pasta.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Harbes 2019 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly sour cherry-skin aromas meet with oak smoke, tar and uncracked peppercorns on the nose of this bottling. There is a tarry aspect to the sip as well, where pepper and herbs lead into a rustic, slightly bitter finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2018 Lone Tree Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a sharpness to the cherry and raspberry aromas on the nose of this wine, with fresh, resinous herbs riding underneath. Cherry and blackberry flavors carry the supple palate, supported by bright acidity and polished tannins that linger in the background.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Brooklyn Oenology 2017 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of condensed blackberry and cherry meld with a cooked down jalapeño tone on the nose. The palate is plush and soft in feel, with easygoing red-berry flavors that end with some astringent tannins on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2017 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Rather closed on the nose, only hints of caraway seed and dark chocolate arise. The palate is more expressive, showing a milk chocolate-dipped cherry flavor that is adequately balanced by velvety tannins and bright acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rockwell 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: Leafy, saucy plum aromas show a ton of pyrazines, while the palate is hard and smacking, with raw acidity. Flavors of red plum, currant, tomato leaf and oregano finish fiery and peppery.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Echeverria 2019 ¡No es Pituko! Natural Wine Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Rather closed on the nose, this wine doesn't reveal much beyond aromas of green herbs and rooibos. The palate offers more green, vegetal tones, mixing in woody stems and a glint of tart red berry fruit. It ends bitter and tannic.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Earthy, murky red-berry and plum aromas are almost nutty, while this feels tight and narrow, with stand-out acidity that complicates balance. Hard-punching flavors of grape skins and leafy plum finish short and rugged.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Morandé 2018 Adventure El Padre Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely fresh aromas of tiny wild berries and red currants meet with dusty herbs, turned soil, wet rocks, dried meat and a hint of leather on the nose of this bottling. The sip is zesty, lively and very fresh as well, combining those brisk red-fruit flavors with generous acidity and a very rocky minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Harrington 2018 Calleri Vineyard Cabernet Franc (San Benito County)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From vineyards on the slope behind Saint-Nicolas, this wine is ripe and dense. Generous red fruits are shot through with a fresher, cooler character from the chalk and flint soil. Rich tannins promise some more aging. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2016 Le Val Renou  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From deep gravel soil to the west of Saint-Nicolas, this wine is rich and balanced despite its modest alcohol. Ripe, firm tannins give the wine richness and structure along with some further aging potential. Perfumed red-berry fruits offer a fresh take. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2016 Le Fondis  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A walled section that forms part of the producer's Quarterons vineyard has given this dense wine. It has the lift and freshness proper to wines from this appellation but with intensity and firm tannins that promise further aging. Drink this wine from 2021. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Le Clos des Quarterons Vieilles Vignes
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2017 Le Clos des Quarterons Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: One of three wines from the La Butte vineyard, this comes from halfway up the slope. The positioning gives the wine a rich style, expressing the vineyard in its ripe black fruits and fine, dark tannins. It is an ageworthy wine, poised and subtly elegant. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2018 Mi-Pente Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: From vines at the highest point of this vineyard, this wine produces generous strawberry flavors and velvety tannins. It is structured, but wears that formation lightly. Drink from 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2018 Le Haut de la Butte Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberry and blackberry aromas are spiced with black pepper, crushed rock and loamy soil on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound at first, slowly unfurling flavors of dark fruit, smoked wood and more stone, all wrapped in lingering tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brady Vineyard 2018 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this 100% varietal wine comes from Destiny Ridge Vineyard. Brooding cigar-box, dried herb and cherry-licorice aromas lead to fruit flavors that show a lovely sense of purity, depth and freshness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Virtue 2018 Temperance Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: The biodynamic farming brings out the bright red-berry fruits of this wine that comes from the lowest part of the Saint-Nicolas slope. It has a fresh feel, open and lightly textured. The juicy aftertaste hints at the core of tannins. Drink now. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2018 Les Quarterons  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine offers ripe black fruits and spicy, smoky flavors. Still young, it has rich potential. Let the fruit and dry core soften and meld. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Saget la Perrière 2018 Marie de Beauregard  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine comes from deep gravel soils on the approach to the Loire river. It is softly textured and light, with crisp acidity. With cherry flavors and a perfumed aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2017 Les Gravilices  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This firmly textured wine offers ripe red-fruit flavors. Juicy fruitiness and solid tannins give it a bold profile, dense while fresh at the end. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Butte 2018 Perrières Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's a pleasing sophistication to this wine, with its aromas of flower, herb and cherry. Like many wines from this vintage, the flavors are light and the tannins are bunched up at present, but there will be good things there when they stretch out. Best after 2022.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lady Hill 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine. Lighter in color than the norm for this variety, it offers aromas of spice, flower, licorice and raspberry. The palate shows sophistication and elegance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lobo Hills 2017 Lonesome Springs Ranch Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This perfumed wine balances fresh blackberry flavors and acidity with a rich texture. Vibrant, fruity and smoky, it offers hints of tannins at the end. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2019  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old vines give concentration to a wine, as is the case with this densely textured, black-fruit-flavored bottling. Tannins and youth are still prominent along with a crisp mineral edge. Let the wine rest a while and open in 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Commanderie 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is ready to drink now, with its spicy, stalky character. Bell-pepper flavors partner with the tight structure, acidity and crisp red fruits.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2018 Elégante  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Juanico, Uruguay
Description: Plum and cherry aromas are clean and presentable, while this Cabernet Franc feels fresh, bouncy and smacking. Cherry and plum flavors come with mild herbal notes in front of a straightforward finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegones Del Sur 2019 Vineyard Select Cabernet Franc (Juanico)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Extracted aromas of blackberry syrup and charred wood consume the nose on this bottling from San Diego County. There are soy-sauce and smoked beef flavors on the palate, as well as a strong berry tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castelli Family Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Crisply textured with black-currant and spice flavors, this perfumed wine was produced from young vines. Hints of toast are balanced by a stalky, mineral character. Still a little tight, the wine will be best from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Commanderie 2018 Cuvée Médiévale  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Berry fruits and soft tannins give this wine a comfortable, fruity character. Freshness contrasts with ripe strawberry flavors. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Garenne 2019  Chinon

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A top bottling of the variety, this small-production wine is structured and strong, opening reductively, with elements of tobacco leaf, oak and sage. The savory character persists in the form of leather and black pepper, allowing just a touch of sharp red fruit to enter and complement. This wine has further secrets to be revealed; enjoy best from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Caladan 2017 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: A rare 100% varietal bottling, this impresses vintage to vintage, this time as a thick concentrated expression of dusty, brooding dark fruit and herb. The full-bodied intensity rides serious structure and refined oak, with accents of leather and sage. This will do well to cellar; enjoy best from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Jota Vineyard 2017 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Opening with a seductive aroma of coconut butter, this is made with the addition of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Petit Verdot, 4% Merlot and 2% Malbec, sourced from a range of mountain sites. Thick tannins gird a wall of blackberry and black currant. This will do well to cellar. Best from 2026–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hertelendy 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Reflective of McLaren Vale's Mediterranean climate, this Franc is plush and full, but it layers flavors of red berries with earthier, more savory, spicy and herbal ones: black olives, bay leaf, fenugreek and black pepper. Like a musical trio, sappy tannins, silky fruit and spice weave in and out of one another on the firm yet luscious palate, and there's a purity unmarred by oak. The last note lingers on those earthy herbs.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Brash Higgins 2018 FRNC Clos Antonio Lamento Cabernet Franc (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine opens in dry tannin and oak, showing its big-boned, structured power up front and center. It begins to reveal its depth of floral, herbal qualities midpalate, as cedar, clove and nutmeg accent sage and dark cherry with ease. With small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot, it will do well in the cellar; enjoy best from 2025–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2017 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Coonawarra, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine shows oodles of bright cherry, clove and star anise, with a soft floral note and a hint of reduction. The palate is medium in weight, but with a feathery quality to the fruit, raspy tannins and a powdery texture. At the close, it shows a lovely, long finish that tastes like Chinese Five spice. Layered, likable and full of personality, this makes for fun, youthful drinking now, but should age until 2030 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penley Estate 2019 Francis Cabernet Franc (Coonawarra)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Cabernet Franc from Stillwater Creek. The aromas are generous, with notes of roasted coffee bean, cherry, plum, flowers and fresh herbs. The flavors pop, with density and a sense of structural tension. Fruit and barrel play equal parts.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sightglass 2018 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Cabernet Franc for this wine comes from Kiona and Olsen vineyard, along with a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon from Dionysus. Aromas of roasted coffee bean, cherry, herb and barrel spice lead to dense, rich coffee and cherry flavors. It shows a lot of hang time on the finish. It's a hedonistic offering of this variety, with the oak (55% new French) playing a prominent part in the show.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sparkman 2017 Yonder Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: A light, elegant approach is taken to this mountain wine, robustly seasoned in sage, dried herb and clove. Herbaceous throughout, it represents the variety, vintage and provenance well, showing balanced, bright underlying acidity that softens the inherent power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mt. Brave 2017 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is the first vintage of Hickinbotham Cab Franc, planted by American Winemaker Chris Carpenter. McLaren Vale's Mediterranean climate and the use of quite a lot of new French oak gives this a riper feel. A perfume of ripe red and blueberry fruit is backed by savory, earthy nuances, green herbs and a blanket of highly polished, mocha-like barrel influence. There's a tangy lift to the fruit, with textural, granular tannins. Drink 2021–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hickinbotham 2017 The Nest Cabernet Franc (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Sourced largely from the producer's own Three Palms Vineyard, this is a warm-climate wine from a warm vintage, brimming in robust dark, baked cherry and plum. Herbal and rounded, it has a fleshy opulence that appeals, finishing in tobacco and crushed rock.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Duckhorn 2017 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a small production wine from a small producer, showing lively acidity and balanced layers of plum, dried herb and sage. Blueberry and mocha flavors add to the elegant mix, the oak well integrated and the tannins supportive.                      Virginie Boone
Name: T. Berkley Wines 2017 Ophelia Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is dry in tannin and seasoned in dried herb and sage, offering varietal character through and through. Black licorice and toasted oak wrap around lively red cherry and plum, as the full-bodied concentration becomes powerful on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Meeker 2017 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from Weinbau, Famiglia and Quintessence vineyards. Aromas of raspberry jam, tar and spice are followed by ripe red fruit flavors that display a sense of elegance. It's alternately a bit overripe and seemingly a little under extracted—a strange mix.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Succession 2018 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: This cooler-climate wine is herbal and tangy in cranberry and currant. Rich and thick, it offers robust tannin and oak, with lingering notes of blueberry and mocha.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hagafen 2018 Wieruszowski Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Baked cherry, scorched soil, fennel pollen and rustic herb aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling. Chiseled tannins frame the palate, where dark-berry flavors remain light and airy, thanks to the crushed rock and baked soil elements in the background. It is quite delicate for a long-aged wine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Riserva Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are arresting, with notes of fresh raspberry, strawberry, cranberry, whiffs of manure and dried herb that show vitality. The palate starts out light and delicate, drinking like an elegant Pinot Noir, with vivid, pure flavors, filling out over time. It's a very pretty expression of the variety, with a strong emphasis on purity. Best after 2023.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this carbonic style of Cab Franc pops with strawberry, white pepper, damp earth and dank herbs on the nose. The palate is deeply herbal and intriguing, offering both fresh and dried pops of marjoram, thyme and even cannabis, all playing against a strawberry and red-plum backdrop.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Buttonwood Farm 2019 Carbonique Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from third leaf, fan trained vines—a long held dream realized for the winery. The aromas are arresting, with notes of plum, ash, sliced green pepper and satsuma. It coats the palate with notes of ember, cherry and herb, with the velvety, high pH feel of the Rocks District sub-appellation of the valley. Smoke notes linger on the finish. It's a unique offering of the variety for the state.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waters 2018 Waterstone Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of flower, dried herb and cherry. The palate is all about tannin and acid structure at first, with the fruit filling in over time.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2018 Resurgent Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A one-of-a-kind wine in the state, aromas of whole green pepper, herb and citrus are followed by tart, acid driven green pepper and herb flavors. It's downright lipsmacking.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Blanc Franc Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This chocolaty, ripe and layered wine is full in weight and moderately tannic. It fills that structure nicely with black cherry, cocoa and black plum flavors for a broad, rich effect on the palate. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, chocolate and herb aromas are out front. Plump, fleshy fruit and barrel flavors follow, accented by bright acidity. It's hard to resist.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Januik 2017 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Rich, deep and well structured, this full-bodied wine delivers delicious blackberry and blueberry flavors and a healthy side of baking spices wrapped in firm fine-grained tannins. It has the concentration and structure for further aging. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2013 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed stone, light herbs, fresh red-currant and dried berry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a textural grip to the sip, where dried cranberry, pepper and light herb flavors play out.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Buttonwood Farm 2017 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This well-balanced and engaging wine offers aromas of blueberries and blackberries, snappy black-fruit flavors and moderate tannins for a full, grippy mouthfeel. Paired with a lamb chop, this will be perfect.                      Jim Gordon
Name: San Rucci 2018 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Black currant and blueberry aromas carry to the palate where dark fruits are joined by cedar and bell pepper. Mouthcoating tannin and bouncy acidity lend structure.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Alain de la Treille 2019 Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Big and structured, this full-bodied wine boasts deep, black-fruit aromas and flavors, firm tannins and vivid acidity too. It's wound pretty tightly and needs a rich dish with which to pair. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2017 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and firmly tannic wine offers herb and green-wood aromas, and tight cranberry, cherry and green-olive flavors. It should mellow with time, but it is still pretty edgy now. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wild Diamond 2014 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Softly textured and juicy, this Cabernet Franc comes from Chinon producer Domaine de la Commanderie. As such, it has a stalky, smoky character, with black currant fruits and easy approachability. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Petite Métairie 2018 #ONO Cabernet Franc Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich and indulgent, this ripe, flavorful wine packs in plenty of plump blackberry and blueberry flavors and wraps them in a velvety blanket of fine-grained tannins. While enjoyable now with rich foods, it will improve through at least 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This beautiful Port-style dessert wine offers tempting, concentrated black-fruit flavors accented by flower and orange-peel notes. It is quite sweet and full in weight, feeling smooth and just a touch tannic in texture. Best through 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hawk and Horse Vineyards 2014 Latigo Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from a vineyard best known for its Cabernet Sauvignon, making this a hidden secret. It brings swoon-worthy aromas of scorched earth, whole green pepper, coffee, cherry and spice, showing nuance. The palate shows a classical, Bordelaise styling to its cherry and coffee flavors that sail off into the distance, further than the eye can see. The texture only ups the appeal. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Avennia 2017 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark, ripe and packed with flavor, the Granit captures the power of the grape, which thrives at this southern Oregon site. Black-cherry fruit is laced with flavors of licorice and espresso, and the tannins have the green-coffee signature of Cabernet Franc. Big and balanced, this will cellar nicely and may be enjoyed over the next decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Division 2018 Mae's Vineyard Granit Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe, robust berry and prune aromas show a strong oak component, while this feels flush and powerful, but balanced. Raisiny berry, chocolate and oak flavors play out on a finish with prune notes. This is mostly about ripe fruit character and richness, not nuance.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rule of Three 2014 Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Cabernet Franc gives a rich, perfumed character to this dense wine. Tannins and concentrated black-berry fruits are threaded together in a ripe, juicy and harmonious combination. This single-vineyard wine will age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Petit Boyer 2018 Unique Terroir Premium Lieu-Dit Galineau  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: This unique dessert wine sports a scent and flavor imbued with mushrooms, along with less savory flavors of orange fruit and rind. Though just 11% alcohol, it is not cloyingly sweet, just sweet enough to serve as a light dessert wine. Or be adventurous and pair it with a mushroom tart.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pillitteri 2016 Reserve Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: With its malolactic fermentation and aging in large barrels this is a rich wine that is now just ready to drink. The black fruits and tannins have softened together, bringing out rich spice and a concentrated structure. While the wine is ready, it will age further and will be at its best from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Commanderie 2017 Tradition  (Chinon)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Leafy, spicy berry aromas are true to the Cab Franc variety and include notes of smoked paprika and fennel. A full palate rings with tartaric bite, while this tastes of spicy black fruits and chocolaty oak. A warm finish caps it off.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Antigal 2015 Aduentus Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With a hearty 22.63% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, this is a deeply concentrated wine, with woody tannin and oak. Elegant red currant and raspberry give it a thick fruitiness dusted in cocoa powder and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Maxville 2016 Cabernet Franc (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from the vineyard, this was given 22 months in barrel, half of it new French oak. Dusty dried herb, blueberry and currant meld around a soft, smoothly round palate of full-bodied intensity and concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sequoia Grove 2016 Tonella Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Mild reduction on a nose that smells of spiced beef, salami with fennel and dark berry fruits leads to a full and layered palate with good natural acidity. Blackberry and cassis flavors are backed by a savory stewed note, while this is smooth and composed on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Argento 2016 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are appealing, with notes of flower, fresh and dried herb, green pepper and dark raspberry. Plump, ripe fruit flavors follow, showing the warmth of the vintage but also the purity of this producer.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Willow 2016 Boushey Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of garden herb, smoke and plenty of vanilla, with the fruit coming off coming off as quite green and the oak out front. Lightly smoky flavors follow, backed by tart acidity. Orange-peel and oak accents flesh it out.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2017 Lawrence Estate Wines Lawrence Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Cedar, pencil shavings and peppercorn greet the nose before juicy, rounded layers of raspberry and blackberry figure in. Soft supple tannin make for a lighter style of intensity, finishing in clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gibbs 2017 Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Although it's 100% varietal, this is a rather light version of this grape, with leafy herbal tones over a veneer of ripe strawberry fruit. The balance is fine, with the acids proportionate, and a hint of green coffee. It was aged in French oak for 20 months.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2014 Ellis Vineyards Block 2 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of berry and cherry, seeming closed up at present. The flavors are ripe and full bodied, backed by grainy, slightly astringent tannins. It finishes warm. It's all an odd mix.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Efeste 2018 Estate Angela's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine offers outstanding value for the quality, a mix of herbal, perfumed oak atop soft, approachable layers of raspberry and cassis. Bright and unfussy, it delivers nuanced flavor and a lasting hint of char.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Delta 2019 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Effusive floral and tropical fruit flavors and a sensation of sweetness make this light-bodied wine festive and appealing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2019 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Niagara Escarpment, Ontario, Canada
Description: Tongue lashing astringency rules the palate, with green tea tannins and more herbs than fruit. It's an earthy, rather green wine, with light hints of sweet baking spices, presumably from barrel aging.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cave Spring 2018 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is bold, concentrated and firmly tannic, holding black-currant, rosemary and toasted oak flavors tightly on the palate. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2017 Thompson Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This standout varietal wine is complex and lengthy in a wealth of juicy red and black fruit, with lasting accents of dried herb, sage, lavender and violet. Built to last, it should develop even more in bottle. Drink 2024–2026.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Jota Vineyard 2016 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a stunning wine from a benchland site, so true to the variety in its violet perfume and underlying power. Tobacco, cedar and dried herb lead to a midpalate of fresh, focused cherry, berry and cassis, with tension and tautly wrapped tannin providing structure and ageabililty. Cellar this and enjoy best from 2027 through 2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Corison 2017 Helios Sunbasket Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Rich with black fruits, this smoothly textured wine has a smoky character from wood aging. Still young and with tannins still present, it is just beginning to show its full richness. It will be best from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2018 Thélème  (Chinon)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Richly layered and concentrated in dark cherry and mocha flavors, this impressive red offers pillowy tannins around an herbaceous kick on the lengthy palate. With a huge finish of oak and structure, it could use some time to mellow. Enjoy 2025–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2017 4 Barrels Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense aromas of blackberry and black currant meet with hints of oak and pepper on the thick nose of this bottling. The density is impressive on the palate as well, where those black-fruit tones met with a pinch of spice. Not very Cab Franc-like, but an impressively dark and deep wine that will age well. Drink now through 2036.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense and dark in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of cassis and black-plum skin as well as lemon pepper and spicy mint on the nose. It's lavish in expression on the palate, where a smooth texture offers boysenberry-jam flavors alongside the telltale Cab Franc tones of cracked black pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Adelaida 2017 Viking Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers earthy sage, diesel, tar and dried herb tones around a core of tart black fruit. Additional accents of gunpowder and toasted oak creep in on the midpalate. The structure is impressive and well-integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mt. Brave 2016 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Dusty gravel and crushed rock earthiness make for a heady, memorable experience in this varietal wine, a standout from the producer. Dried herb, currant and cassis mingle around a soft well-integrated texture of lengthy tannins and classic oak, the body full and fleshy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Mondavi 2016 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Snappy black-raspberry, white-pepper, wet earth and crushed stone aromas makes for a classic Cab Franc nose on this single-vineyard expression. The palate is tightly wound and refreshing, with light herb and pepper spices enhancing the underripe boysenberry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: E11even 2017 Curtis Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: These dry-farmed old vines lend considerable character to the resulting wine. In this case, that means aroma of roasted plum, berries, dark slate, crumbled purple flowers and a hint of toasty sandalwood on the nose. The palate is tense, dense and yet remain fresh with acid, with a cracked peppercorn kick atop the blackberry core.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Tinaquaic Vineyard Old Vines Dry Farmed
Name: Foxen 7200 2017 Tinaquaic Vineyard Old Vines Dry Farmed Cabernet Franc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a regal sense of restraint in this bottling, starting with a light color and aromas of strawberry, white pepper, marjoram and baked soil. Crisp cranberry and raspberry flavors are layered with wild chaparral and desert herbs, a style that will work well with a wide variety of foods, from tacos to tenderloin.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: I. Brand & Family 2017 Bayly Ranch Cabernet Franc (Paicines)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Named after the mistress of French King Charles VII who lived nearby in Loches, this wine is rich and concentrated. Its has plenty of the smoky character typical of Cabernet Franc. Everything is extra rich and dense, with powerful black fruits and layers of tannin. Age the wine further and drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2018 Cuvée Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum and boysenberry aromas are lifted by violet on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard's newer vines. There is compelling density to the sip, where berry-paste, black-pepper and crumpled purple-flower flavors make for a very floral and lively sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foxen 7200 2017 Tinaquaic Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright blackberry, crushed black-pepper, carnation and black-tea aromas make for a varietally correct entry to the nose of this bottling. There are firm tannins up front on the sip, but they allow wild berries, peppery spices and pencil-shaving flavors to come forward.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kessler-Haak 2017 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Jeff Grier. Attractive herbal and earthy characteristics lead the nose of this wine, with tones of red raspberry leaf, plum skin and cherry stem that sit atop an earthy core of green peppercorn and tobacco leaf. The palate is medium-light in weight and quite spicy, with moderate tannins and ample acidity that create a nice satiny texture and a lingering impression on the finish, with juicy flashes of plum skin and cherry flesh.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Villiera 2018 Cape Winemakers Guild Drop Barrel Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Suave aromas of blistered strawberries and darker boysenberries meet with a satisfying stony quality on the nose of this bottling, which also shows some loamy earth tones. Hearty blackberry-jam flavors on the palate are layered with oregano, peppercorn and a hint of oak, showing a zesty freshness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: E11even 2016 Curtis Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Eric Santier created a rich, smoothly textured wine that has benefited from the concentration of the vintage. It is ripe wine full of spicy black-berry flavors. Soft tannins are already integrated into the fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Clos du Saut au Loup Monopole
Name: Domaine Dozon 2018 Clos du Saut au Loup Monopole  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Proof that Cabernet Franc in Chinon can age well in the historic tuffeau cellars, this wine is still approaching its peak. Wood aging and 50-year-old vines have given great richness and density along with spice and smokiness. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Crushed thyme, violet, singed rosemary and black pepper make for a pretty, earthy entry to this red. The palate is velvety smooth in feel, showing a juicy red cherry flavor that's propped up by well-mannered tannins. A streak of graphite chimes in on the finish, giving a mouthwatering tang to the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2017 Caya Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This stylish, single-parcel wine is aged in tank to preserve freshness and fruitiness. Acidity and red-berry flavors meld with a hint of pepper and smokiness at the end. Still full of young fruits, the wine will benefit from more aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2018 Les Loges  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, herbaceous and intense in earthy tar and bark, this wine shows its underlying oak and tannins well, with a touch of gun smoke lingering on the finish. The red and black fruits are brawny.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Imagery 2016 Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This stylish, single-parcel wine is aged in tank to preserve freshness and fruitiness. Acidity and red-berry flavors meld with a hint of pepper and smokiness at the end. Still full of young fruits, the wine will benefit from more aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2018 Les Loges  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 100% varietal, aged in clay tinaja for 20 months. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of freshly chopped cherry meat, savory herbs, mineral and green pepper, showing an appealing sense of purity. Full-bodied flavors coat the palate, with a firm tannic structure backing it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Covington 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from 50-year-old vines planted in Cravant on the north bank of the Vienne, this rich and concentrated wine is dense with red fruits, firm tannins and alternate layers of acidity and spice. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2017 Cuvée Terroir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
