Description: Concentrated, dark and tannic, this full-bodied wine packs in dense flavors of blackberry jam and dark chocolate wrapped in a firm layer of tannins. Further sipping reveals tones of baking spices, which also carry through to the finish. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael David 2017 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Niagara Escarpment, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Tightly coiled aromas of red currant and cherry are lifted by accents of crushed herbs and stone on the nose. With more time in the glass, well-integrated tones of warm spices chime in. The medium-bodied palate is driven by juicy thick-skinned red berry flavors, with graphite and herbs adding depth. The tannins are well-knit and firm, lending ample support alongside integrated acidity to make this a well-balanced offering from the Western New York region.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Freedom Run 2017 Estate Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: With its classic smoky and red-berry flavors, this wine bursts with fruitiness. Tannins give a backdrop to this juicy character that would benefit from further aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Duveau 2018  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With this 100% varietal, light aromas of jammy red and black fruit, cedar and herbs are followed by ripe, full flavors that initially paint around the edges before coalescing in the middle. It has a big-time yum factor.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Covington 2016 Franc Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Aromas of earth, warm spices and red cherry coulis form the nose of this Cabernet Franc that sees 15 months in oak. The palate shows a pleasing mix of ripe red-berry flavors wrapped in allspice. Finely knit tannins are fleshed out by juicy acidity, giving this wine immediate appeal to enjoy in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2017 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this red is juicy and high toned, with spicy clove and dried herb accents atop the nuanced dried currant and cranberry. Balanced and medium in weight, it shows balance and elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ancient Oak Cellars 2014 Alcaeus Reserve Berger Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The intense smokiness of this wine is balanced by perfumed red fruits that come through the ripe tannins. Acidity and a light touch of structure allow the wine to keep freshness and accessibility for the short term, Drink the wine from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Varenne 2018 Tradition  (Chinon)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a bright, herbal offering of the variety, 100% represented here, that is richly concentrated in black fruit, lavender and licorice. Acidity keeps it fresh and helps to underscore its essential herbaceousness and earthy black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lang & Reed 2016 Two Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of savory herb, pencil eraser, smoke, barrel spice and cherry are out front. Lip-smacking, elegant pomegranate, chocolate and cherry flavors follow, with light grainy tannins backing it all up. It brings a sense of freshness. The tannins need some time to settle in.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2017 Waliser Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lavish oak spices and a velvety, tannic texture make this full-bodied wine extra dramatic. Thick scents of vanilla, mint and cinnamon lead to roasted berry and tobacco flavors that are concentrated and lingering. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 2Plank 2016 Cabernet Franc (Amador County)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of ripe cherry and currant meld with singed rosemary and black pepper on the nose. The palate is light in feel but ultraslick in texture, with velvety smooth tannins and juicy acidity building the frame. Firm red berries and slightly charred herbs move to crushed stone on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2016 Caya Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas delight, fresh and fruit filled, with notes of fresh black currant, plum, boysenberry, tangerine rind, coffee bean and herb, with the palate showing more of the same. A light smoky streak runs through it. It's a fascinating offering of this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Freehand 2017 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lovely aromas of dried herb, scorched earth, ripe raspberry, crushed dried leaves and anise are out front. The palate brings lightly tacky-feeling cherry and chocolate flavors, showing the wine's youth. It needs some additional time in the bottle, but all of the stuffing is there. Best after 2022.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2017 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This opulent, mouthfilling wine lavishes oak spices over extra-ripe berry and maple-syrup flavors. Slightly sweet and very expansive in texture, it's a guilty pleasure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cosentino 2018 The Franc Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: In the same family since 1835, this estate has produced a purely fruity wine. Touches of spice with light stalkiness balanced by perfumed acidity come together harmoniously. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2018 Tradition  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Although best known for its white and dessert wines, this estate also produces an exemplary red. Slightly stalky but with plenty of smoky richness, the wine still has young red fruits that are just beginning to soften. Over the next few months, the wine will broaden out, so wait until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fesles 2017 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: In the same family since 1835, this estate has produced a purely fruity wine. Touches of spice with light stalkiness balanced by perfumed acidity come together harmoniously. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2018 Tradition  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Producers for three generations, the Gouron family creates wines that reflect the terroirs of their different vineyards. This bottling is rich and fruit-driven, with a delicious smoky character and acidity over the red fruits. It has spice as well as density. Pepper at the end comes from the high alcohol. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2018 Terroir  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A ripe wine with good interplay between fruit and tannic structure, this has weight that is pierced with juicy acidity and black-currant flavors. The wine is poised and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2018 Expression  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The smoky aromas of this ripe wine penetrate into the spicy, fruity palate. Generous black fruits are lifted by acidity and filled out by the structure. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2018 Cuvée Domaine  (Chinon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a fairly extracted style of Cabernet Franc, with black-plum syrup and dried flower aromas on the nose. The texture is a bit simple on the sip, where black-plum flavors meet with light minty tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Larner 2017 Earthfluence Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Spicy, saucy berry aromas are typical of Cabernet Franc, especially Uco Valley Cab Franc. A tight palate with tomatoey acidity is rubbing, while herbal plum and berry flavors include a patented CF note of bell pepper. On the finish, this is dry and pulls at the cheeks, with flavors of tomato, spice and plum.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca la Celia 2017 Pioneer Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green pepper, garden herbs and stem are at the fore. The palate brings soft, creamy, chocolate and green pepper flavors that persist. Coffee notes linger on the finish. There are good things going on, but they don't all seem to be in sync at present. Tasted twice with consistent notes.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2016 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly smashed blackberries, dusty herbs, light leather and a hint of peppercorns show on the nose of this bottling, which is still quite young. Grippy tannins frame tangy black-plum and cracked pepper flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kempe 2017 Cabernet Franc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: The perfume of this spicy, stalky wine underlines the black fruits. It is already balanced, ready to drink with its firm berry flavors and acidity.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2018 Les Mauguerets La Contrie  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Rich, layered and textured, this robust red has well-integrated tannin and moderate structure, with densely concentrated flavors of cinnamon, clove and black cherry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Prothro 2017 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Mild aromas of bramble berry, crushed herbs and eucalyptus carry the nose of this wine, which is from a vineyard that is overlooked by Olana, the historic home of landscape painter Frederic Church. The palate is light in feel but filled out by juicy tones of thick-skinned dark berry flavors and crushed herbs. The tannins are like a felt blanket covering the palate with a warm embrace, yet properly lifted by a jolt of acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2017 Olana Vineyard Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Orléans-Cléry, Loire Valley, France
Description: The entire appellation is just 67 acres, so this wine is rare. The Cabernet Franc in this cool region brings out a stalky character. Managed well, as at this estate, it balances that with attractive red-plum and spice flavors that are light and give the wine immediate drinkability.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Saint Fiacre 2018 Cabernet Franc (Orléans-Cléry)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A supple texture and ripe, gentle fruit flavors are accented by vanilla and cinnamon in this full-bodied, light-tannin wine. It was matured for 26 months in French oak.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This juicy wine is full of blackberry flavors that are laced with acidity. Balanced with perfumed fruits and a core of tannins, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2018 Expression  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh carnations, hibiscus and pomegranate meet with rustic black pepper and a hint of game on the nose of this bottling. Riper cranberry flavors, more pepper and a pinch of oregano converge on the refreshing palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Roblar 2018 Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A bright note of crushed raspberry and cranberry carries accents of pink peppercorn and herbes de Provence. The palate is light and racy, showing streamlined flavors of tart strawberry and hibiscus wrapped in a green, herbal undertone. The tannins are delicate, but a bit raspy, giving grip to an otherwise fleeing palate.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2018 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The smooth tannins in this wine show its easy accessibility. They go with the juicy red fruits, touch of smokiness and the attractive acidity. The wine will develop quickly so drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2018 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This perfumed wine is full of red fruits and attractive acidity. The creamy mousse fills the mouth with ripe fruitiness as well as a light touch of tannins. It is fragrant and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Montfort NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Niagara County, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A bright cherry aroma mixes with potting soil and red flowers on the nose. The palate is plush and rounded in feel, with delicate tannins lending support to flavors of cherry and vanilla. Juicy acidity lifts it all up, keeping it fresh and brisk.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Chateau Niagara 2018 Cabernet Franc (Niagara County)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Stalky, spicy and with a tannic core, this is classic, cool Cabernet Franc. Herbal flavors, black currants and lively acidity combine in a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fesles 2016 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smoky aromas and stalky fruit come from some crispness in this textured wine. The smokiness and blackberry fruits are allied to layers of tight acidity. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Géléries 2017 Les Chënes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Touraine, Loire Valley, France
Description: This pale, salmon-pink wine is spicy and fruity, with a tangy texture. It has a lightly tannic character as well as plenty of freshness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Vieil Orme NV Gabriel Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Touraine)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This light, smoky wine has crisp red fruits and plenty of acidity. Freshness is balanced by the luminous fruitiness, giving a fresh while spicy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Géléries 2016 Les Chênes  (Chinon)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This fresh, crisp red-berry flavored wine has bright acidity as well as a light touch of tannin. The wine is fruity, perfumed and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Puy 2019  Chinon

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A light raspberry aroma mixes with crushed pepper and baking spice on the nose. This is light in weight, but silky smooth in feel, displaying an easygoing frame of juicy red fruit against a zesty backdrop.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2017 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A mild nose of hibiscus tea and cranberry carries the nose. The light-bodied palate offers zesty red fruit flavors, with bright acidity pushing it along. Delicate tannins provide just enough grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2017 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: La Consulta, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Grainy oak aromas lead a nose that includes earthy plum and prune scents. While this is snappy and dry in feel, it's also notably woody and resiny. Heavy oak flavors dominate dried berry fruit, while this remains woody and dry on a spicy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Chaman 2017 Cabernet Franc (La Consulta)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This bottling is one of this producer's range of simple, fruity wines from across the Loire. From the western Loire vineyards, this wine is spicy, full of red fruits and finished with acidity. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Laporte 2017 Le Bouquet Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A fruit-forward nose of mixed berry jam shows a shade of tilled earth. While light in feel, the palate is smooth and silky. A bouncy cherry flavor fills it out, with just enough acidity and gossamer-thin tannins providing the frame.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2018 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pencil shavings, cedar and herbaceous dried herb form around a thick midpalate of substantial tannin and weight in this varietal wine. An easygoing texture and structure inform the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Spice aromas are front and center in this wine, displaying tones of vanilla-soaked cherry and toast and black pepper. It's soft and supple in feel on the palate, echoing the same tones as the nose, with a clipped finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glorie Farm Winery 2018 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Aromas of charred red cherry and raspberry meld with hefty doses of tomato paste and allspice on the nose. The palate is ultraracy in feel, driven by tart flavors of unripe currant and strawberry, with a savory tone chiming in on the midpalate. The finish leans a bit sour.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Milea 2017 Estate Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: High-toned blueberry, black plum and blackberry aromas contend with peppery spice on the nose. Ripe and tangy berry fruits open the palate, backed by tar and tree sap. It finishes hot and spicy, with a grip of tannin.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Restoration 2016 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Tulum Valley, Other, Argentina
Description: Forceful aromas of clove and rubber sit on top of herbal fruit scents. On the palate, this is scratchy, while a heavy coating of unnatural oak flavors, namely clove, are out front and carry over to the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Somewhere Else 2017 Cabernet Franc (Tulum Valley)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Flint and steel set the tone on the nose, blending aromas of black plum, sage, white peppercorn, goji and fallen leaves. The palate offers bruised black cherry, vanilla and charred oak. Peppery spice and charcoal flavors mark the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Grande River 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: This effusive, complicated and intriguing site-specific red is blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Tones of jalapeño, pencil lead and saddle leather contrast against a velvety wall of dark cherry and vanilla. It is muscular yet well integrated, with a crushed-velvet texture on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: H.W. Crabb's Hermosa Vineyard Block 5 Crabb's Black Burgundy
Name: The Vineyard House 2015 H.W. Crabb's Hermosa Vineyard Block 5 Crabb's Black Burgundy Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine offers refined aromas of violet and herbs on the nose. A creamy texture upholds flavors of currant and clove, while accents of oak are integrated and add to the foundation.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Will Jarvis' Science Project Estate Grown Cave Fermented
Name: Jarvis 2016 Will Jarvis' Science Project Estate Grown Cave Fermented Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lovely, crisp wine is fermented in stainless steel. Herb, cedar and garrigue elements meet a juicy, sublime midapalate, finishing on highlights of lemon peel and cassis.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cenyth 2019 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the famous, high-elevation site in the new Moon Mountain appellation, this estate wine is beautifully rendered in red fruit, clove, cedar and moss. With a lean, mineral-driven midpalate of crushed rock and iron, it builds to a powerful finish of tannin, oak and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong array of classic but often overwhelmed Cabernet Franc aromas to the nose of this bottling, including black pepper, pasilla, dusty berries and a touch of underlying oak. A compelling texture upholds herbaceous flavors of rosemary and more pasilla, which add complexity to the blackberry base.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Joullian 2017 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is varietally correct and appealing, a complex mix of peppery spice, dried herb and sweet tobacco. Pencil shavings and black currant are secondarily present. Powerful and dense, the wine is a candidate for aging; enjoy from 2026–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Oakville East 2016 Franc 'N Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This watermelon-hued rosé offers impressively vibrant aromas of freshly squeezed Montmorency cherry and blood orange peel, mixed with a light crushed-stone accent on the nose. The palate is juicy and fruity, with pulsing acidity pushing along the tart cherry flavor. Tart red fruit skins and stone offer grip, with a gentle bit of tannins lending a firm feel.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2019 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Black cherry and black raspberry aromas blend with peppercorns and tobacco on the nose. The palate offers black plum and blueberry, layered with cayenne and sweet baking spices. Sandy tannins envelop the palate, but the acidity is equally powerful, and they come together in a perfect tango. The finish extends the palate, adding a tart cranberry note.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Sutcliffe 2016 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pale pink in the glass, this zesty rosé offers bright aromas of strawberry, lemon, crushed stone and white blossoms on the nose. The palate is light in feel but persistent in its freshness, carrying lots of juicy red-fruit flavors along with delicate pepper and herbal nuances. This has good grip and presence, with the fruit and spice notes to match.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine aged 26 months in neutral French oak, this impresses in its thickness of plum and dark-currant fruit. Nutmeg and clove accent a hearty grip of tannin and long, vanilla-oaked finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Spicy Vines 2017 Cabernet Franc (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Copper orange in color, this wine is herbal, grassy and stony, with a weighty core of body and texture on the midpalate. Entirely varietal, it offers structure and rich tones of cherry and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Majuscule 2019 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Carneros)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: The nose combines aromas of black raspberry and cherry with pine cones and warm baking spices. The berry notes continue on to the palate, joined by vanilla, cedar, clove and tobacco. Tart acidity keeps things fresh and energetic, while crushed velvet tannins add structure without overwhelming. Berry notes turn tart and linger long on the finish with a sprinkling of black pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Buckel Family Wine 2017 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Grand River Valley, Ohio, US
Description: Aromas of ripe cherry, wild strawberry, red plum and crunchy bell pepper flirt with a barnyard notion on the nose. Flavors of red apple skin, red plum, cherry and wild raspberry blend with more telltale Cab Franc bell pepper. The palate is light and flirty, with crisp, refreshing acidity and gentle brushes of fine, sandy tannins. Charming and easygoing, spice comes through on the finish lingering long in cherry and pomegranate flavors.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Debonné 2018 Cabernet Franc (Grand River Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Raspberry and cherry pop on the nose, with some vanilla, pepper and leather tones adding depth. The tannins offer gentle grip, but the acidity is tart and sunny, keeping this fresh and structured, and giving a solid base to flavors of ripe plum and tart cranberry wrapped in vanilla. It finishes on tart berry, with lingering tannins making this a good match for fatty protein.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2018 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Freshly cut green pepper aromas pop, leading to flavors of cherry and Serrano pepper. The finish is quite smoky. It's green even by the variety's standards, drinking more like an underripe Carmenère.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2017 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Reduced and somewhat muted in its youth, this wine has yet to unwind, showing a disjointed element of herbaceousness against a sweetness of vanilla and cola.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Majuscule 2018 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: Aromas of warm cinnamon, baked cranberry and pear are highlighted by leather and cigar box. The drying tannins are fine grained in texture, with a quiet power on the palate paired with mild acidity. Flavors of blueberry, blackberry and black cherry combine with tree bark, charred oak and cigar box, and a menthol tinge on the finish lingers with dry, intense tannins.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Turquoise Mesa Winery 2016 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: A highly vegetal nose of bell pepper and tomato leaves only suggests some red fruit lingering in the background. The palate combines bruised apple and overripe plum, with lingering tannins and vanilla.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Carboy 2018 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Aromas of lingonberry, black berry and flower stem are scrambled together on the nose. The palate offers red apple skins, black raspberry and currant, with plenty of peppery spice and oak tones. Good tannic grip with sandpaper texture offers plenty of structure and balanced acidity. Oaky tones take over the finish with vanilla, toasted wood and charred Shishito pepper paired with red berry acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Snowy Peaks 2018 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: This wine is layered in vanilla and baking spice as well as cedar and firewood, with a touch of raspberry on the nose. Oaky tones persist in leather and charred tobacco leaves on the palate. Bullish tannins are gritty and incessant, but the acidity cuts the tannins on the finish and lingers on char.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Aspen Peak 2018 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Colorado)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: A spectacular year for icewines, this exotic and beautiful wine—a stunning burnt-orange hue—boasts 244 g/L of residual sugar, yet is not a bit syrupy. Strawberry jam, blackberry pie, toffee, coffee gelato, cinnamon spice and more—the hits just keep on coming. One half-bottle, expensive though it is, will stretch for a half dozen sweet tooths as long as you take plenty of time to savor the lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Inniskillin 2017 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a new partnership between neighbors Luisa Bonachea, a trademark lawyer, and winemaker Ryan Pass, whose day job is with Farella Vineyard. Named for the Basque word for house, this red is incredibly impressive—a light take on a classic variety from a classic mountain site. Herbal, earthy and floral, it sings on the palate in crisp red fruit, vibrantly fresh texture and lasting elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Etxea 2017 Pickberry Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: From the vineyard around the winery property, and the addition of only 1% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a worthy representation of how beautiful the Cabernet Franc grape can be. Herbal, earthy and structured, it has thick, firm tannin and dry, toasted oak, with intense layers of black currant, violet and blueberry. A dusty texture gives it grip and complexity. Enjoy in good time; this should be stellar from 2026–2031.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Clos du Val 2016 Hirondelle Vineyard Estate Cabernet Franc (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dusty cherry and berry aromas are earthy and highly natural, with no overripe notes or oak. A full, ripe palate offers fine balance between weight and elegance, while this tastes of clean black fruits prior to a finish with dry tannins. This is fresh and exact, with little of the herbal character that often comes with Cabernet Franc. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Zorzal 2017 Eggo Franco Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: From the estate created by the late Anne-Claude Leflaive of Domaine Leflaive in Burgundy, this wine is beautifully structured, perfumed and ripe. Smoky tannins link with generous berry fruits to give a wine that is still aging and deserves more time. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clau de Nell 2017 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This racy Cabernet Franc from winemaker Sebastián Zuccardi is made entirely in concrete. Plum and berry tones are full and fresh on the nose and palate, while flavors of black fruit, herbs, tea and tomato linger on the smooth finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Poligonos del Valle de Uco San Pablo
Name: Zuccardi 2018 Poligonos del Valle de Uco San Pablo Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is now almost mature, although it could age further. Ripe red-berry flavors and spicy tannins have softened to give a wine that is well balanced. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Raifault 2016 Clos du Villy  (Chinon)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Exotic aromas of lavender, violet and cardamom are big players on a nose that's unusual and highly intriguing. High acidity pushes the palate into the citric and tomatoey zone, while snappy flavors of berry and plum finish with some sharpness related to ribald acidity. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Calcáreo Granito de Tupungato Michelini Sammartino
Name: Superuco 2017 Calcáreo Granito de Tupungato Michelini Sammartino Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from vines that are more than 60 years old, this wine is rich, aged in wood and powered with dark tannins and smokiness. Its fruitiness is now calming into a ripe, full character. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2017 Improvisation  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Focused aromas of blackberry paste, crushed peppercorns and a hint of oak are clean and inviting on the nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is creamy at first before tannins rise up to provide structure, as flavors of roasted berry, leather and pepper show. It is rich, but with character.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dracaena 2017 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: Jammy strawberry and raspberry fruits dive deeply down the flavor tunnel, seeming to add concentration and power as they linger and resonate. Though not especially complex, this seems less syrupy than some of the winery's other Icewines. It's finished at 212 g/L residual sugar.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Red Leaf 2016 Icewine Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart red-currant, dark-strawberry, dried meat and flower-petal aromas emerge with patience on the evolving nose of this bottling. The palate offers the grape's hallmark flavors of cracked pepper and fresh raspberry, leading into a baking spice finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Left Bend 2015 Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Spicy oak aromas play nicely with core blackberry and black plum scents. On the palate, this is chewy and concentrated, with hard tannins. Generous flavors of black fruits, dried beef, herbs and chocolaty oak yield to spice and vanilla on the finish. While this is an excellent and full-flavored red with ample oak, it's a bit shy on Cab Franc character; maybe more time in the bottle will bring that out. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Decero 2017 Decero Mini Ediciones Remolinos Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Joyous aromas of red and black cherry, vanilla pastry and French toast are leveled by a wet slate minerality on the inviting while complex nose of this bottling. Ripe strawberry, cinnamon and cardamom flavors are very hard not to like on the palate, which is medium bodied and fruity yet dry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pear Valley 2017 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Tightly wound black fruit aromas come with tension as opposed to being overripe and overoaked. This Cab Franc is lively and powerful, with tolerable tartaric scratchiness. Ripe berry, cassis and dark plum flavors are lightly spiced prior to a lusty but short finish with a touch of heat. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casarena 2017 Single Vineyard Lauren's Vineyard Agrelo Cabernet Franc (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Jammy black plum and blackberry aromas include hints of oak, varietal spice and herbal notes. A healthy palate is flush and supported by easygoing tannins. Mixed black fruit flavors come with a touch of Cabernet Franc's noted herbal character, while this feels steady and smooth on the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sur de los Andes 2017 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied red currant, baked strawberry and light baking-spice aromas make for an inviting nose. A rounded cherry flavor is framed by oak spice and prominent tannins, which ensures this wine, while delicious now, will also evolve over time. Drink now–2032.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Valley View Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of dark fruit, herbs, green pepper, dried tobacco and spice lead to black fruit and coffee flavors. Lightly tacky tannins provide support. Give it another few years in the cellar to settle in, but it has all the stuffing to go the distance. Best after 2023.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusted Valley 2017 Southwind Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling from a vineyard just a mile east of Carmel Valley village shows rich aromas of black currant yet with a spicy licorice kick. That licorice and dark-berry combination soars on the palate as well, proving both hearty yet still offering the grape's inherent spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boete 2017 Saunders Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: While this wine has some age, it still shows considerable acidity. A light touch of tannin and plenty of perfumed fruitiness give a wine that has structure and that will age. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clau de Nell 2016 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a pleasing intensity of cranberry and bramble berry on the nose of this red, with lifted elements of crushed herbs and pepper. The medium-bodied palate shows a framing of integrated tannins and bright acidity around flavors of cherry, cranberry and a slight woodsy element. Peppery spice rises up on the finish of this red that saw nine months in French oak.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: French consultant Jean-Claude Berrouet is helping Zolo's team make fresher wines at lower alcohol levels, and this wine fits the bill with its aromas of earth, cinnamon and berries. It's fully ripe but not heavy on the palate, showing gamy, herbal and berry flavors that are typical of the variety.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Zolo 2017 Reserve Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Soft, supple and richly etched in red fruit, this wine is also earthy in cedar, tobacco and dusty rock. Tight, firm tannins give it pronounced structure and elegance around peppery spice and lasting oak, the wine aromatic in mountain violet and sage.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This young, fruity wine comes from vines owned by the Pitault-Landry family. It has an edge of tannins and freshly spicy fruits. Smoky, perfumed and packed with berry flavors, the wine will develop further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Pins 2018 Cuvée les Rochettes Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Old vines are behind this rich, wood-aged wine. The smoky, stalky character shows the youth of the wine. With its red-fruit flavors, the wine has considerable potential. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2018 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe plum and berry aromas are punchy and a bit raw, while this Cabernet Franc is driven by wiry acidity. Flavors of oaky graphite and peppery berry fruits have a chocolaty background note, while this finishes with racy freshness and lightly herbal flavors.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2017 Don Nicanor Barrel Select Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Early reduction results in gaseous aromas of olive and rubber, but once this breathes and expands you get meaty, earthy berry scents. A solid palate offers spicy dark plum and berry flavors, while on the finish this Cab Franc is firm and balanced.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Passionate Wine 2018 Montesco Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

Appellation: San Benito, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and earthy aromas of forest floor, damp herbs and wild cherry show on the nose of this bottling from a county east of Monterey. Dried blackberry flavors and underlying hints of fennel and dried mint arise on the sip, which is framed in a chalky texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jason-Stephens 2016 Cabernet Franc (San Benito)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of blackberry and cinnamon meld with gentle shade of crushed herbs on the nose. There's a pleasing depth of blackberry and cherry flavors on the palate that are lifted by a violet tone. It shows good balance and grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Boundary Breaks 2018 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This red shows a pleasing mix of fruit and earth on the nose, displaying raspberry alongside tilled soil, red flowers and black pepper. There's solid intensity to the red fruit on the palate, with a floral note lingering throughout. A gentle cherry-pit astringency marks the close. Enjoy with a slight chill.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2018 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright, defined aromas of raspberry preserves, dried herbs and pepper carry the concentrated nose. The palate is rounded and silky, yet properly lifted by integrated acidity and a framing of well-knit tannins. It's a tasty, juicy red, showing raspberry and bramble berry flavors, with shades of herbs on the side. Drink with a slight chill.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2018 Woodland Cherry Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Paraje Altamira, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Exotic, minerally berry aromas hint at violet and fine herbs, with spice and cardamom notes in the background. A tight palate is dry and elegant, while this tastes of plum, wild berry and exotic spices. Dry tannins and freshness on the finish are what Paraje Altamira is all about. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ginard Ballester 2017 Antonia Ginard Cabernet Franc (Paraje Altamira)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This spicy, perfumed wine with ripe blackberry flavors and zesty acidity adds richness to the bright fruits and tangy texture. The aftertaste has just enough fruitiness to allow the wine to age further, until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Duveau 2017  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lifted aromas of black pepper and violet ride over a raspberry core on the nose. The palate is silken and smooth in feel, showing a pleasing cherry juice tone that's lifted by integrated acidity and a delicate frame of tannins. It's on the lighter side of things, but wholly delicious.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Osmote 2018 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Rich with wood aging as well as broad red fruits this ripe wine is just approaching maturity. Its smoky character and dry tannins are still in place although softening. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2018 Le Grand Bouqueteau Réserve  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced from 50-year-old vines, this wine has not been in wood. That explains its stalky black-fruit character as well as the crisp texture that is still apparent in this mature wine. Smoky and crisp at the same time, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2015 Les Loges  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This classic stalky, spicy wine offers green-pepper and red-fruit flavors. Crisp, still young and perfumed, it will age further. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Fontaines 2018 La Cornemuse Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and rich aromas of cranberry, dried flowers, loamy earth and black plum show on the nose of this bottling. There is strong acidity on the sip and lots of peppery spices, as well as cranberry, vanilla and a touch of leather, which reveals the age of the wine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Coquelicot 2015 Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Light ruby in color, this Cabernet Franc kicks off with a pretty mix of cherry, stem, cinnamon and rose on the nose. The palate is light and silky in feel yet properly poised by bright acidity. Crunchy red fruit and slight tannins make this a good candidate to chill and glug.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Kelby James Russell 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is full of fruit. Aged for 10 months in tank, it still shows fruit tannins as well as plenty of blackberry flavors. Spice and perfumes shine in this lightly structured wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Pins 2018 Cuvée Clos les Pins Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of dried tobacco, braised green pepper and peat. Peat and cherry flavors coat the palate. It's a unique interpretation of the variety, interesting but not for all tastes.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kitzke 2016 Candy Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Washington)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: A snazzy package, complete with a metal logo, introduces a well-made wine with a mix of purple berries and sweet cherry fruit. The earthy tannins bring a wash of espresso and chamomile tea. The wine spent two years in 80% new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pillitteri 2015 Exclamation Cellar Series Reserve Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Niagara Escarpment, Ontario, Canada
Description: Cabernet Franc is a bit of a surprise success here, but it's reasonably well ripened, and the cranberry fruit has a pleasant roasted character. There are baking spices also, and though it's a lighter style, the balance and complexity make for an interesting experience.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cave Spring 2017 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This domaine with vineyards on the flats west of Chinon has made a beautifully smoky, stalky wine offering spice and ripe blueberries. A fresh wine that's still young, it will be ready to drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Raifault 2018 Cuvée Tradition  (Chinon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe and bright raspberry aromas meet with slightly darker fruit as well as charred wood on the nose of this bottling. There's a flash of sweetness at the tip of the lightly bodied sip, where candied fruit flavors lead into hints of wet soil and oregano.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa San Juliette 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a classic fruity, lightly stalky Cabernet Franc. Tannins are present, supporting the attractive berry flavors and acidity of this perfumed, smoky wine. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Petite Roche 2018 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This spicy wine has a good balance of red fruits and acidity. The floral character brings out freshness and contrasts with the smoky aromas. Without wood aging, the wine's fruitiness is just right now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2017 Tradition  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A straightforward nose of raspberry and cherry starts off this single-block wine. While there's a nice roundness to the feel of the palate, along with ripe cherry and raspberry flavors, the concentration is on the lighter side.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2018 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: A soft, open wine with plenty of blueberry and spice flavors, this is lightly structured and likely to mature quickly. Drink this juicy, fruity wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Pins 2018 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Violet, dark plum and a hint of vanilla show on the somewhat tangy nose of this bottling. That tart and tangy aspect also shows on the lively palate, where oak and purple-flower flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jamie Slone Wines 2016 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Highly herbal aromas of oregano and thyme suggest pizza and spaghetti sauce. On the palate, this is extracted and creamy. Heady black fruit flavors are herbal and saucy, while this tastes of oaky vanilla and herbal black fruits on a warm to hot finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Fabre Montmayou 2018 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This unoaked Cabernet Franc opens to a nose of charred green bell pepper. The palate is soft and light in feel, with a cranberry-raspberry flavor that's sprinkled with more green notes. The acidity is well honed, with slightly raspy tannins marking the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2018 T23 Unoaked Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pepper, menthol and dried leaves are lifted on the nose, with cherry and raspberry coulis at the core. It shows a juicy raspberry sauce note on the palate, with more earthy, forest floor-driven tones. There's good depth and structure to this red, with a well-knit frame of tannins and integrated acidity lending ample lift.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Point of the Bluff 2018 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Niagara-On-The-Lake, Ontario, Canada
Description: Opening with a lightly smoky nose, this shows a mix of black currant, mushroom and coffee ground flavors, with sharp tannins and an herbal edge. It's a solid effort that reflects the specific terroir and style of the region.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pillitteri 2015 Cabernet Franc (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Light ballerina pink in color, this wine offers a shy nose of grapefruit, wet stone and white flowers. There's nice roundness on the palate, showing melon and tangy citrus peel, with sourness rising up on the finish alongside a yeasty note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Anthony Road 2019 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This shows a properly dense wild berry core on the nose, with pronounced tones of dried leaves. The palate is soft in tannins but lifted by a balanced amount of acidity. There's a dried leaf character on the palate as well, with a solid bramble berry core.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Weis 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A quiet nose of bramble and cherry starts this off, with a hint of wood spice riding in the background. The palate is soft in feel and laden with a noticeable oak sheen. It's light in profile, with a shot of tart cranberry creeping up on the midpalate and finishing quickly on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2017 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of flower, fresh herb and mesquite, with the reserved palate showing more of the same. It shows a lot of smoke influence.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: GFW 2017 Vino Cluster Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, herbal and tannic, this wine is dry and overtly oaky, with a one-dimensional approach. Full bodied, it offers a taste of blueberry, spice and earth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Meeker 2016 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Niagara Peninsula, Ontario, Canada
Description: Astringent, earthy and bitter, the tannins take over immediately. What little fruit is here is on the green side, with mushrooms and leather notes.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: North 42 Degrees 2018 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of grape soda and cherry mix with a heady paint thinner tone. The palate is thick in feel from heavy tannins, while the fruit is concentrated and jammy. Bright acidity lifts it up, but the tannins take hold on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Cabernet Franc, this radiant red opens with intense aromas of black currant, Mediterranean scrub, blue flower and camphor aromas. On the supremely elegant palate, supple tannins and bright acidity accompany cassis, black raspberry, crushed herb and licorice before a cedar finish. It's smooth, radiant and delicious, with great energy. Drink 2022–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Macchiole 2016 Paleo Rosso Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of flower, raspberry, dried and fresh green herb, mushroom, dried orange rind, cherry, spice and moist earth, showing a mesmerizing sense of purity and detail. The flower-filled palate is sleek and lithe, with a mouthwatering sensibility and a long finish. It's a dazzler. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Two Blondes Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Deep and powerful fruit flavors energize this full-bodied wine from within, streaming black cherry and blackberry across the palate as well-integrated tannins build a hefty but smooth texture. Subtle oak spices of vanilla and cinnamon emerge with time in the glass. Best through 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mineral Wines 2017 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Bolgheri, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opulent 100% Cabernet Franc opens with inviting aromas of black-skinned berry, bell pepper, graphite and Mediterranean brush. The concentrated, savory palate offers black currant jam, licorice, black pepper and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio al Tesoro 2016 Dedicato a Walter  (Bolgheri)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Powerful fruit flavors meet spicy oak and a good, firm texture in this concentrated and well-balanced wine from a tiny, quality-focused producer. The tasty black-cherry and tobacco notes have great depth and length. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Occasio 2016 Del Arroyo Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a big, rich, opulent wine that is concentrated and deep in fruit, olive and herb flavors, and nicely structured. Aged in French oak for 30 months, it offers an abundance of fine-grained tannins that coat the palate and help the roasted black-plum flavors linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2015 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Berry and plum aromas come with varietal green-leaf accents. A solid palate is a bit choppy and tannic, while dark-berry, plum, spice and chocolate flavors wrap up on a flush finish with residual herbal notes. Drink this surprisingly excellent Cab Franc through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Haras de Pirque 2016 Galantas Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a new offering from the winery, coming within a stone's throw of Two Blondes Vineyard, where it also makes a varietal offering. Aromas of cinnamon, strawberry, mushroom, cherry and red plum rise up from the glass. Light, pure, exquisitely balanced flavors follow. Nuance, intensity and an alcohol level unheard of in modern days in the state for a red or even most whites (11%). It's an accomplishment of a wine. Might be too light and airy for some tastes, but others will swoon. As always with this producer, put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Pollard Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc opens with dark-skinned berry, bell pepper and tobacco aromas. The savory, balanced palate features juicy black currant, mocha and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2016 Scipio Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Varietally familiar aromas of tomato leaf, herbs, plum and currant are fresh and inviting, while this Cabernet Franc feels full and dense but balanced by lifted acidity. Spicy berry and herbal flavors are true to the grape, while touches of oak and chocolate are welcome on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Garzón 2018 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc opens with aromas reminiscent of dark fruit, bay leaf and baking spice. The dense, round palate offers prune, clove and espresso alongside chewy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Val delle Rose 2016  Maremma Toscana

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: This Cab Franc punches above its weight (and price) class. While the nose is mostly made up of ripe berry aromas, there's a note of grilled meat that is appealing. On the palate, this is solid and fresh, but tannic. Lightly herbal black plum, cherry and berry flavors are bolstered by a grip of tannins on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Calcu 2017 Reserva Especial Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Maldonado, Uruguay
Description: Spicy notes of cinnamon and clove lead earthy plum aromas, while this Cab Franc is grabby and rubbery in feel. Oaky, woody clove and berry fruit flavors are full and satisfying on a solid finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alto de la Ballena 2015 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Maldonado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This concentrated and firmly structured wine needs time in the cellar to resolve its grippy tannins and let the underlying ripe fruit, herb and tobacco flavors emerge. It has a tight mouthfeel and finish at this point. Best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Andis 2017 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed Cabernet Franc, this has aromas of bell pepper, bay leaf and dark berry. The savory palate offers black plum, mocha and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria di Magliano 2016 Altizi  (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Atlantida, Uruguay
Description: Raisiny berry aromas are accented by vanilla on a nose that's hard to identify as Cabernet Franc. A smacking, grabby palate is rambling, while this tastes mostly of spicy oak and berry fruits. On the finish, this is loud but short on elegance and harmony.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bracco Bosca 2018 Gran Ombú Cabernet Franc (Atlantida)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Earthy, chunky berry aromas are inexact and a touch funky, while a dry, sinewy palate is extracted and overweight. Earthy, saucy plum and berry flavors are herbal, then olive and beefy notes appear on a thick finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Garzón 2017 Petit Clos Block #560 Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Sagrada Familia, Chile
Description: Spicy red fruit aromas are more basic than detailed, while this Cab Franc is fairly lean, raw and sappy on the palate. Plum and currant flavors are fresh in front of a lighter-bodied, scratchy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Single Vineyard Old Vines Barrel Aged
Name: Valdivieso 2015 Single Vineyard Old Vines Barrel Aged Cabernet Franc (Sagrada Familia)

Appellation: Bolgheri Superiore, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc has subdued aromas evoking toasted oak, vanilla and hay. The dense palate offers mature black plum, roasted coffee bean and coconut alongside bracing tannins. It has a tart, drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa di Terra 2015  Bolgheri Superiore

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Meaty, leafy, savory flavors meld with tasty raspberry and sour cherry notes in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It captures the authentic, wild and earthy character of the grape variety and is well balanced for drinking now.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brice Station 2017 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Firmly structured and tightly tannic, this wine holds its nervy red-cherry, dried herb and dusty oak flavors very close. The tannins are gripping and conspire with good acidity for a lean texture. Best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Writer's Block 2017 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This bold and full-bodied wine is deep in color and full of smoky, spicy flavors that are more prominent than the black-plum and black-olive core. It's tannic and structured, giving a gripping texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ironstone 2017 Estate Grown Reserve Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tart blackberry and black plum mix with a kiss of oak on the acetic nose of this bottling. More tang shows on the sip, where black plum and vanilla meet with violet.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Gershon Bachus 2015 Erato Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Progreso, Uruguay
Description: Reedy aromas of mulchy red plum set up a palate with rubbing, scratchy tannins. Soupy plum, tomato and red berry flavors finish shallow and with earthy overtones. While good, calling this Cab Franc fresh and clean would be an overstatement.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Progreso 2018 Overground Cabernet Franc (Progreso)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine was made in microscopic amounts but it is so worth the search. Leathery cola, turned earth and smoothly integrated tannin and oak make for an elegantly styled, complex and balanced wine, dazzling in black cherry and dense, dusty mineral.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Battle Family 2017 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: It's been quite a few vintages since this unique white wine was last reviewed, and the improvement is remarkable. A light straw color, it's intensely aromatic with a mix of white flowers, golden raspberries and a whiff of blood orange. Complex, thickly layered flavors follow green apple, fresh lemon, savory herbs and toasty hazelnut, from aging in acacia wood. Simply stunning from start to finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2018 Mae's Vineyard Blanc de Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the only example of this variety I am aware of from the state all aged in stainless steel. The aromas offer uncommon purity, depth and detail, with notes of strawberry, raspberry, herb, whole orange and whiffs of cranberry. The palate is layered and exquisitely balanced and has a long, orange- and cranberry-filled finish. It's spectacular—an accomplishment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Animale 2016 Stainless Steel Aged Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: This perfumed wine with hints of spice and blackberries comes from a single parcel. Its richness and succulent acidity reflect the quality of the old vines and their fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2017 Château Tour des Gendres Cabernet Franc (Côtes de Bergerac)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Aromatic, as are all of Leah Jørgensen's wines, this weaves a bit of smoke through a mix of sweet and bitter herbs and red fruits—cranberries and pomegranate and stewed cherries. Still young and pulling those flavors together, it builds upon balanced and complex components that trail into a lingering finish, reflecting far more care and polish than most wines at this price. Give this another year or two before opening that first bottle.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2018 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This limited, reserve-level wine spent 15 months in neutral oak and another nine in bottle, yet still seems a bit closed down. The barrel aging has helped to smooth out some rugged tannins, and the cranberry-cherry fruit flavors are crisp and vibrant. It may yet show its best stuff with additional bottle age; for now a good decanting is recommended.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2016 Clos Rogue Valley Reserve Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Mount Gambier, South Australia, Australia
Description: From a tiny, high altitude region near the border of Victoria, this naturally made Cab Franc is complex yet highly drinkable without a lick of funk. Black cherry-hued, it opens with notes of black olive, licorice, dark chocolate, damp earth and wild bramble berries. There's some power in the mouth but an ease, too, as though comfortable in its own skin, unforced by winemaking trickery; a flow of juicy brambly fruit, crystalline acidity, sinewy tannins and a mineral, sanguine note toward the finish. Drink now with wintery fare.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Good Intentions 2018 Frankie Cabernet Franc (Mount Gambier)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright, achingly pure aromas of raspberry, strawberry and cranberry are followed by palate-coating fruit flavors that show more of the same. A long, blood orange- and cranberry-filled finish follows. It's a complete delight—one of the best offerings of this variety coming out of the state.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Animale 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ample fruit flavors and light oak spices give this well-balanced and well-rounded wine plenty to savor. It's full bodied, nicely packed with ripe black-cherry and black-plum notes and has a moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Designation: The Hill Sachau Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2016 The Hill Sachau Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Aegean, Turkey
Description: Deep violet in the glass, this wine has a nose of cassis, anisette and juniper berry. Firm tannins offer a backdrop to flavors of black cherry, raspberry, milk chocolate, fennel bulb and lavender, with a soft floral note on the gentle finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Selendi 2017 Sarniç Akhisar Cabernet Franc (Aegean)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Herbal accents, low alcohol and a firm dry texture make this medium-bodied wine taste savory and restrained. Fermented with 25% whole clusters, it shows notes of bay leaf, olive and pomegranate, along with tart cherry and wood smoke, and should make a great pairing with roasted birds.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Halcyon 2017 Barsotti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lewis-Clark Valley (ID), Idaho, US
Description: Aromas of fresh and dried tobacco are at the fore along with green, savory herbs and green pepper. The palate is light but full in feel, chock-full of savory flavors. It's a lovely but pretty green offering of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Colter's Creek 2017 Estate Cabernet Franc (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: There is a thin veneer of black cherry fruit, accented with a hint of cola. Those flavors quickly veer into a thin, tannic and earthy finish, which cuts the fruit short. Extra aeration is recommended.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Season 2015 Limited Edition Series Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: We know what a special vineyard this is for Cabernet Sauvignon, but this wine shows that the grape's progenitor can excel there, too. Its 100% varietal, alluring aromas of raspberry, earth, herbs and flowers focus the attention. The palate is dense and textured, full of dark-fruit flavors with a firm sense of tannic structure. The balance is impressive. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2017 Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lamorinda, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very dark color is the first sign of the extreme concentration in this medium-bodied wine. Aromas of mint, cedar, dill and vanilla give evidence of plenty of new oak in the aging process, while deep, dark black-cherry, blackberry and blueberry flavors form the core. It's tempting to drink now, but will be best after 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meadow View 2017 Isabelle's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Lamorinda)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: An enticing minty overtone joins plump black-fruit flavors in this excellent offering. It is full in weight, supported by firm but fine-grained tannins that enhance the depth of flavor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2017 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Concentrated black-fruit flavors are wrapped in velvety tannins and sophisticated oak spices in this very full-bodied wine. Cinnamon, mint, dark chocolate and black cherry crowd the palate and fill the mouth for a very broad, flavorful effect. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2016 Ovis Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich in flavor and well balanced, this full-bodied wine delivers big, ripe cherry and blackberry flavors, but also good acidity and moderate tannins that give it an appetizing texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cuda Ridge 2017 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Enchanting aromas of dried leaf, cherry, mocha, coffee and herbs dance in the glass. The palate brings brawny tannins and fresh dark-cherry flavors. This one would benefit from some time in the cellar. Best after 2022.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2017 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a vineyard in the North Fork region of the valley that ranges from 1,500 to 1,700 feet in elevation, this 100% varietal wine offers aromas of herbs, vanilla, cherry, baker's chocolate and anise. Soft green pepper, cranberry and raspberry flavors follow, showing a sense of elegance and length. The oak (25% new French) is dialed back. It's a very pretty, distinctive offering of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tertulia 2017 Elevation Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a big wine, quite full-bodied, packed with flavors and laced with plenty of fine-grained tannins for structure. Cedar, tobacco and grilled plums crowd the aromas while rich, mulled cherries fill the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Halcyon 2018 Camino Alto Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This earthy, savory wine from one of the few Cab Franc specialists in California shows feral aromas and complex, herbaceous, meaty flavors that challenge the notion of the varietal. It is medium bodied, firmly tannic and offers an interesting path worth taking.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lang & Reed 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From an unirrigated vineyard that was planted in 1985 from vines that were imported in the early 1900s, this bottling offers dried red plum, earthy mint and baked soil on the nose. It's very rustic on the palate, where dried red fruit and turned loam flavors meet with forest mints and damp wood.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2016 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an on-point Cabernet Franc, representative of its peppery, fresh possibilities rather than disguised by too much oak as is common. Fruity aromas of wild blackberry, red currant and hibiscus lead into a palate of strawberry, white pepper and dewy herbs—tasty and easy to quaff.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2017 Lone Tree Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a good example of the Loire-Chinon style of Cabernet Franc in California. It's a medium-bodied wine that relies on complexity, nervy acidity and elements of herbs and minerals for its savory appeal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Halcyon 2018 Barsotti Vineyard Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Three days on the skins yield a wine that's medium ruby in color, with a gentle perlage rising up in the glass. Aromas of crushed strawberry and cranberry meld with a candied violet accent on the nose of this sparkling Cabernet Franc. The palate is tangy and fruity, with a hint of green herb undertones that provide a pleasant lift. The tannins are faint but provide a nice frame for the delicate bubbles and tart red fruit flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots NV Traditional Method Sparkling Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark berry, light mint and pleasantly gamy aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling. It's dark and yet quite lively on the palate, where black currant and blackberry flavors are lifted by peppery spices and stiff tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Hall 2017 Cavern Select Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dark, brooding oak spiciness comes off as cloves and wood smoke in this full-bodied wine. Rich, cooked plum and black-cherry flavors form the core while full body and a mass of fine-grained tannins create a mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Exaggerated oak spices in the aroma lead to concentrated cranberry, red cherry and dark chocolate on the palate in this full-bodied wine. It shows a warm layer of fine-grained tannins surrounding rich fruit notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vinum 2016 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Half-and-half Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay from Touraine, this wine is ripe, full in the mouth and rich with white fruits and ripe acidity. A warm wine, it is now ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Vieil Orme 2017 Cuvée Gabriel Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is moderately fruity and savory in flavor, but those elements are held tightly by firm tannins. It comes off as tight and restrained, with fruit flavors that aren't quite ripe or full. This vineyard is known for producing slow-maturing wine, so it's best to drink after 2022.                      Jim Gordon
