Name: Halcyon 2018 Alder Springs Cabernet Franc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Green tea, green herb and smoke aromas are followed by soft, chocolaty flavors with quite firm tannins backing them up. It paints around the edges.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2017 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Crémant de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Caramel aromas and a soft, creamy mousse mark out this perfumed wine. With its red-berry flavors and light acidity, the wine is ripe, fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Celene NV Ballarin Cuvée Noble Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A rich, almost sweet baking-spice aroma and similar flavors rest on a relatively soft texture of mild tannins and low acidity in this full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2016 Miller Cabernet Franc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of orange oil, flowers and black licorice lead to quite smoky fruit flavors that show some astringency.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2017 Piloti Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is smoky in oak and gamy meat, with dense red-fruit flavors and a full-bodied structure on display. Cedar, dried herb and peppercorn add savory complexity that make this hard to resist.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kenzo Estate 2016 Asuka Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Nevada County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Powerful and concentrated, this full-bodied wine offers interesting complexity, well-integrated oak and some of the spicy black-peppery nuances of the grape variety. Aromas of cedar, sage and wood smoke lead to a saturated flavor of blackberry and black cherry wrapped in firm but not tight tannins. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starr 2016 Rising Starr Cabernet Franc (Nevada County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This concentrated and aromatic wine captures the classic character of this French varietal with precision. It shows black fruit and roasted herbs in the aroma, and potent cranberry, blueberry and wood smoke on the palate. The structure is firm and moderately tannic, so there's no great hurry to enjoy it. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Chateau Molyneaux 2016 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe blackberry aromas are cut with cracked peppercorns and charred pasilla chile notes on the nose of this bottling. Dark boysenberry, lava rocks and more pepper spices are all apparent on the dense palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tantara 2016 Mateo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of blueberry and red plum meld with thyme and perfume on the nose. Cranberry and cherry notes are ripe and upfront on the palate, paired with crisp, tart red apple and bright acidity. A firm grip of tannins provides a solid frame for the juicy fruit flavors.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Lovingston 2017 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of fresh pastries and berry pie meet jammy, ripe and almost thick blackberry and boysenberry flavors. This is a full-bodied, bombastic and delicious wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael David 2016 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is easygoing, broad in texture and full bodied. It's generously oaked, having been aged for 20 months in 41% new barrels, but not overworked, offering a rich mélange of baking spices, currants, cherries and cedar.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Great balance and an appropriately firm texture complement the ripe but dry character of this fruity and savory wine. It is moderately tannic and will be best paired with something meaty. Best through 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Thompson Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Bright cranberry and holly aromas are inviting and paired with cozy baking spice and vanilla tones. Ripe and juicy flavors of fresh raspberry and cherry are coated in creamy vanilla and clove on the palate. Gentle tannins lend structure to the soft mouthfeel, while lifting acidity keeps the creamy flavors light. It slips into a medium-length finish, with the berry flavors turning pleasantly tart.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Signature Series Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: A spicy, peppery nose brings together pomegranate, blackberry, blueberry, clove and Christmas spice. Powdery tannins are kept in line by broad swaths of acidity on the palate, where tart cranberry and cherry ride high above earthy kitchen herbs, baking spice and forest floor. The finish turns a bit spicy and lingers on fruit tones of tart raspberry and red plum.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Pearmund 2017 Toll Gate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Forest-floor aromas lead the nose, alongside purple flowers and black plums with sprinkles of white pepper. The richly fruited palate is carried by sweet plum and black cherry flavors that are joined by savory spices and supported by crushed velvet tannins.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Fox Meadow 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: A delicate, floral nose combines blackberry, cassis and violet aromas with a pine forest undercurrent. Ripe berry flavors of foraged blackberry and pomegranate are bright on the smooth, medium-bodied palate, backed by creamy vanilla and cocoa, crushed velvet tannins and lithe acidity. Acai and currant linger with a touch of peppery spice on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Rappahannock Cellars 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia's Eastern Shore, Virginia, US
Description: This Cab Franc is blended with 9% Petit Verdot. The aroma melds cranberry and red currant with a base of bramble, forest floor and a hint of barnyard. Lighter in style, with pleasant yet slightly lazy acidity and rounded tannins, this wine has juicy and brambly berries and plums that lead the palate with a firm backbone of woodsy, pine and oak flavors. Tart cassis and wood tones linger with powdery tannins on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Chatham 2017 Church Creek Cabernet Franc (Virginia's Eastern Shore)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine exudes distinct fruit and savory flavors that make a nice change of pace. It's well balanced, full bodied but not extreme, lifting red and black currant above black plum and showing accents of roasted herbs and black olive.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rock Wall 2017 Heringer Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Spicy, leafy black fruit aromas are a touch green, which is nothing abnormal for Cabernet Franc. A creamy, saturated palate is dense but a touch flat, while this tastes of roasted black fruits, spicy oak and clove. Oaky notes of mint and spice control a modestly structured finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Garzón 2017 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Cabernet Franc is loaded with licorice, root beer, clove and vanilla aromas. Ample sandy tannins provide a backdrop for flavors of blueberry, vanilla bean and wood tones. Spice emerges on the finish as it gently falls away.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Villány, Hungary
Description: Garnet colored in the glass, this Hungarian Cabernet Franc has aromas of green herbs, green pepper and black currant. In the mouth, it is pleasantly tart, with soft tannins and flavors of black currant and black raspberry.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Jackfall 2015 Cabernet Franc (Villány)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Funky cedar, wet horse and varnish aromas mingle with light menthol tones and a red currant accent. The palate is made up of lightly chalky tannins, mild acidity and flavors of dark plum, blackberry, vanilla bean and tree bark holding steady through the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Rosemont 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The strawberry, veggie and white-pepper flavors of this full-bodied wine are certainly unusual. It's something to try when shaking up the usual wine lineup.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meadow View 2016 Lamorinda Isabelle's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Gritty black fruit aromas include a note of black olive and also a fatty scent. A smacking, bright palate runs mostly on acidity, while this Cab Franc tastes of plum and herbs. A lean finish shows just enough substance to hold form.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Familia Traversa 2017 Traversa Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made entirely from the one variety, this is light in color and beautifully composed, a study in structure and graceful texture. Red cherry and pomegranate play around complementary characteristics of rose, dried herb and cedar, finishing with plenty of fresh acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cenyth 2018 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh, bright aromas of red cherries meet with red flowers, vanilla and dried chile pepper on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate offers a wide array of cherry, rosewater, cracked pepper and hints of spicy chiles. It goes great with a slight chill.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Lanterns 2017 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: A flavorful core of dried cherry and roasted plum supports accents of wood smoke, singed herbs and balsamic in this full-bodied, mouthfilling and very rich wine from the tiny hillside vineyard of Sol Rouge. Firm tannins give it grip on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2014 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A tight bramble-berry aroma is lifted by intense notes of crushed black pepper and earth. The medium-weight palate offers flavors of crunchy dark cherry and currant, with pepper and dried herb tones reining it all in. There's a tautness to the overall feel from the tense acidity and firm tannins making it savory and mouthwatering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2016 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dense aromas of red cherry and black raspberry meld with lifted elements of fennel frond and menthol to create an intense combo. There's plushness to the palate in crunchy cherries and tart black berries, with accents of pepper and herbs. Firm tannins offer a pleasing clench alongside lifted, juicy acidity. Drink through 2024.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Damiani 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: Plummy flavor complements richer tones of dark chocolate in this thick, viscous and robustly structured wine. Firm tannins provide additional weight and breadth along a spectrum of toasted oak and softly spiced earthiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: For this 100% varietal, three-quarters of this wine comes from Stillwater Creek Vineyard, with the rest from Conner Lee. Aromas of dark coffee, herb and cherry lead to full-bodied flavors with a generous oak treatment. A lingering finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sightglass 2017 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Soft, sultry and spicy, this 100% varietal wine is from a low-yielding vintage and appellation, with blockbuster characteristics of blackberry, black cherry and black pepper. Clove, cigar box and earthy tannin add additional savory flavor around a grippy texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of cranberry, raspberry and hibiscus mix with shades of fresh green herbs and pepper in this vibrant Cabernet Franc. Flavors of juicy red berry and plum are propped up by tangy acidity and light, sandy tannins that extend the fruity tones on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2017 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine shines in dried herb, pencil shavings and sage, the earthiness undeniably present. Juicy and broadly expressive in thick, elongated tannins and prominent oak, the fruit is both dried and baked, a mix of black cherry and plum. This will do well with more time in bottle. Enjoy 2021–2025.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sosie 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Block K5 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A pretty nose of red flowers, cherry, hibiscus and dill grace the well-concentrated nose. There's a juiciness to the medium-bodied palate in bright pops of cherry and cranberry, with well-knit tannins and delicate spice framing it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2017 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Deeply textured and robustly ripe, this is a brooding and lengthy 100% varietal wine—a seductive combining of tar, clove and cedar. The black fruit is smoky and concentrated, seasoned generously in dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sosie 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Block K5 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of soil and crushed gravel meet with a fresh and buoyant streak of red fruit and peppercorn on the nose of this bottling. The structure is firm and taut but not chunky, with flavors of boysenberry, elderberry liqueur and more rocky earth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A pretty nose of red flowers, cherry, hibiscus and dill grace the well-concentrated nose. There's a juiciness to the medium-bodied palate in bright pops of cherry and cranberry, with well-knit tannins and delicate spice framing it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2017 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of red fruits and hibiscus concentrate mix with milk chocolate on the nose of this bottling. Tart red fruits, black plum and cracked pepper spice come through on the palate, which combines riper flavors with a fairly firm structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brecon Estate 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Robust tannin structure defines an expansive palate of generous red cherry, cassis and toasted oak in this varietal wine, which is blended with small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. From the mighty mountain appellation, it shows earthy sage and lavender throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's density to the nose in aromas of green tobacco leaf, peppery spice and dark bramble berry. Medium in weight, it shows a pleasing roundness to the dark fruit on the palate, propped up by medium-granined tannins and fresh acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2017 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright ruby in color with purple highlights, this dense Cabernet Franc boasts a wealth of dark cherry and currant tones, lifted by accents of moss, violet and hibiscus. There's ample weight and power to the dark fruit on the palate, propped up by fine yet firm tannins and juicy acidity. It shows good balance and intensity, with a stony granite note lingering on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This Yarra Valley version of Cabernet Franc from Punt Road is spicy on both the nose and palate, dripping in whole bunch stalkiness complete with cinnamon spice, crunchy red fruit and an earthy spine. The stalky flavors taste a touch bitter, especially on the finish, but fans of this style will dig its up-front likability and unpretentiousness—a red to be chilled and chugged.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Punt Road 2018 Cabernet Franc (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This lithe Cabernet Franc is fresh and crisp in sour cherry and cranberry flavors, honed by slightly scratchy tannins and plenty of juicy acidity. Enjoy with a slight chill and pair alongside roasted poultry or barbecue fare.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lifted aromas of red flowers, tilled earth, eucalyptus and pepper ride over a well-concentrated core of cranberry and cherry. Medium in weight, the palate is propped up by firm tannins that support dense red-fruit flavors, with specks of earth and spice tones filling it out.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: A single-variety bottling of Cab Franc isn't a common sighting in the Barossa, yet this small batch, minimal intervention, hazy-cherry-hued wine shows tons of varietal character even in this sun-soaked region. The nose is unmistakably CF, with heady notes of cherries, strawberries, green stalks, black olives, bitter herbal tonic and lots of savory undertones. As promising as the nose is, the palate is less cohesive. The crunchy red-fruit-spice-and-stalks combo is there in full force but the tannins are angular and a little bitter. Nevertheless, this is worth trying for the novelty factor alone.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Geyer 2017 Seaside Cabernet Franc (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, plum, green herb and cherry aromas lead to fuller-feeling dark-fruit flavors. Dark chocolate notes linger on the finish. There's a lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2016 Elephant Mountain Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe cherry and raspberry aromas meld with delicate sweet spice tones on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is juicy in sour red cherry, with tangy acidity and a granite twang pushing through.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lucas Vineyards 2017 Reserve Estate Collection Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a lithe and racy Cabernet Franc that dazzles in tart cranberry and cherry flavors. Accents of violet and crushed herbs lend lift alongside bright acidity and supple tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe cherry and blackberry aromas meld with savory spice on the nose, leading to a rounded soft palate. Bright tangy acidity accents violet and earth tones, with powdery tannins extending on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paumanok 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extracted aromas of black plum and pepper spices show on the nose of this bottling. Dark red cherries, oak smoke, baking spice and cracked pepper show on the cohesive palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sevtap 2016 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Aromas of dark coffee, cherry, plum and fresh and dried herbs lead full-feeling cherry and plum flavors. There's a lovely sense of balance to the fruit, herb and coffee flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Watermill 2017 Estate Dugger Creek Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted berries, vanilla extract and damp wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Rich blackberry-jam flavors meet with the tang of balsamic on the palate, which offers flashes of acid against an extracted core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: F2 Wines 2016 Falconiere Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Subdued aromas of dark cherry and cranberry start off on the nose, with racy pepper and graphite lifting it up. The medium-bodied palate offers a sour cherry flavor that's dotted with sweet and savory spices.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fulkerson 2017 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Medium ruby in color with slight garnet hue, this is a lithe red with brisk cranberry and eucalyptus tones. Juicy acidity is the driver on the palate, with a light toasty edge and firm tannins framing it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Varietal bottlings of Franc are an extreme rarity from this Syrah-heavy appellation. This example leans hard into the green, with aromas of garden greens, dried Satsuma orange, coffee and plum. Soft, plump flavors follow, with coffee notes on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Watermill 2017 Hallowed Stones Estate Cabernet Franc

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of black raspberry, briar patch and black pepper translate to the medium-bodied palate. There's just enough acidity to cut through the weight, with savory spice and delicate tannins framing it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2017 Woodland Cherry Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aged for 27 months in French oak, this wine carries a wealth of toasted spice aromas around a ripe cranberry core. It is lithe in feel, supported by light tannins that offer a gentle grip and juicy acidity that lifts flavors of tart red berries and peppery spice. A slight bitterness marks the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A veil of oak and rubber covers the nose, eventually revealing pretty red fruit beneath. The palate is a bit thin at first but broadens out to juicy cranberry and cherry, with soft tannins providing mild grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This lithe Cabernet Franc offers a focused nose of cranberry and hibiscus, leading to a light-bodied palate that's driven by tangy acidity and tart red-berry flavors. Soft tannins provide a mild grip, with delicate savory spices marking the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: Reductive oak greets the nose of this wine, which features sizably chunky, chalky tannin and plenty of dried herb. Full bodied and thickly ripe, it has enduring viscosity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: William Harrison 2016 Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Toasted oak and rooibos dominate the nose. A ripe cherry flavor pops up on the medium-bodied palate, with plenty of toasty spice and char pushing through.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Inspire Moore 2017 Wisdom Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of coconut shavings, cereal and sweet milk mask the fruit tones in this wine. The medium-bodied palate shows more fruit in the way of soft red berries, yet sweet oak tones rise up on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2017 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With 7% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a succulent, structured, reserve-worthy wine. Spicy clove and vanilla oak support a full-bodied core of layered cassis and blueberry, finishing with powerful concentration and richness on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Peju 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, concentrated and strongly tannic red wine from the famous site, sizzling in spicy black pepper and clove. Intense and full bodied, it has flavors of black currant, leather and cocoa powder dusted in oak. Hold it back and enjoy from 2026–2031.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine opens in thick, burly tannin, black fruit, dust and sage, showing its additions of 16% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Tar, smoky oak, grilled meat and coffee round out the experience, while a softness builds on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: A pure and tight berry-fruit nose offers notes of earth, graphite and barrel char. This Cab Franc is choppy and jagged on the palate, but full of berry fruit. Spicy plum and wild berry flavors finish with a chocolate note along with herbal hints. Overall, this leaves no doubt as to its origins; it's a big Chilean red all the way. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maquis 2013 Franco Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Herbal and brimming in violet aromas, this is a 100% varietal wine that shows old-world classicism, its tannins structured and behaved. Pencil shavings, red currant, cassis and smoky oak combine effortlessly along a high-toned palate of underlying freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Corison 2016 Helios Sunbasket Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: High-toned red fruit meets dark chocolate and sage in this hearty red wine, blended with 7% Merlot and 7% Sangiovese. Cassis, currant and blueberry play around structured tannin and a softness of texture, finishing in varietal dried herb notes, cedar and graphite.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Lost Chapters 2014 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from one of the area's premier vineyards, this is a one-of-a-kind wine in the state: a white Cabernet Franc, whole cluster pressed and aged in stainless-steel tanks for six months. After starting out a touch reduced, aromas of spicy herb, whole green pepper and citrus lead to medium bodied, layered, acid-driven flavors. It's a knee buckler, with white wine acidity but the body of a lighter red.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Blanc Franc White Wine Red Willow Vineyard
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Blanc Franc White Wine Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: Aged in clay amphorae after fermentation, this wine is full of ripe tannins and perfumed black fruits. It's still young, with exuberant freshness and chewy tannins that give life to the fruit. Drink this wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Laulerie 2016 Juste Terre Cabernet Franc (Bergerac)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding aromas of baking spice, black cherry, graphite, black currant and anise carry to the rich palate. The warmth of the vintage is on full display in this hedonistic offering of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: King Estate 2016 Weinbau Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bordeaux Supérieur, Bordeaux, France
Description: The cigar-box perfumes of Cabernet Franc are unmistakable, as is the stalky structure of this young wine. With its wood aging and spicy character, this wine is worth aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Ribebon 2016 Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Red-plum and bell pepper aromas are joined by a lightly funky barnyard note on this Cabernet Franc blended with 10% Petit Verdot. Juicy red fruits: plum, cherry and cranberry lead the palate, with a grip of polished tannins caressing the tongue bringing flavors of thyme, vanilla and oak. Buoyant acidity pushes through the tannins to a mouthwatering cranberry and strawberry finish with savory herbs adding depth.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 22% Cabernet Sauvignon from the estate, this wine is thick in sandalwood, red currant and dried herb, structured and balanced in ripeness. The tannins are well integrated and supportive, allowing room for fresh acidity to brighten its lushness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pride Mountain 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Concentrated tones of dried herb, leather, red currant and cassis combine on the softly tannic palate. Smoky oak, meat and cedar add to the nuance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: William Hill Estate 2016 Winemaker's Series Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This sanguine, herbal wine has an explosive midpalate of oaky cherry and dusty tannin, delivering on its varietal promise. Hearty and full bodied, it balances its savory personality well against a backdrop of red fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Peju 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Blackberry, black-currant and black plum aromas are anchored by earthy cocoa and fallen leaves on the nose. Fruit flavors of pomegranate, cranberry and wild blackberry are bright on the palate balanced by firmly structured, dusty tannis. A solid vein of acidity hovers from start to finish ending on notes of oak, graphite and tart plum.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Smoky oak, sage and sanguine red fruit form the core of this classic, old-world styled red, 100% varietal and from the producer's mountain estate. Intensely structured and dense in tannin, it shows potential for aging, with high notes of herb and pencil shavings.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jarvis 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Rich plum and vanilla aromas are spiced with pepper, cinnamon, clove and thyme on the nose. Dusty tannins are well structured and deceptively silken, while acidity zags in and out in a way that is surprising yet exciting. The palate is filled with bright, ripe cherry, plum and vanilla as well as cocoa powder and crushed herbs. The acidity gives a final red-berry push through the finish introducing whole peppercorn and a lingering caress of tannins.                      Fiona Adams
Name: DuCard 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Ruby with a wide pale rim in the glass, aromas of cranberry and foraged berry meld with fallen leaves and a mild cedar-chip note. Red berry and plum are tart up front, with bright lingering acidity. Tannins build toward the finish with firm grasp bringing raw oak flavors alongside nutmeg with black raspberry and black pepper lingering through the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Paradise Springs 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Buzet, Southwest France, France
Description: A young, fruity and perfumed wine, this is attractively fresh. Light tannins suggest that the wine should age well, bringing out fruitiness as well as a smoky character from the Cabernet Franc. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignerons de Buzet 2018 Les Vignes de Peyrau Cabernet Franc (Buzet)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Notes of fresh strawberry, cherry and cranberry are joined by bell pepper and a barnyard aroma that fades with air. Flavors of strawberry and plum are bright, while savory herbs, vanilla and pink peppercorns soften up the midpalate. There is a final burst of acidity on the finish lingering on pepper, black currant and soft powdery tannins.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2017 Estate Reserve Block 7 Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Deep ruby with a magenta rim, peppercorn and tart raspberry meld together on the nose. Bright tart plum and cherry are quickly joined by charred oak and vanilla on the palate. The tannins are firm and persistent, loaded with black pepper spice and a touch of heat through to the finish where dark berries take over the fruit.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Rappahannock Cellars 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Licorice, bell pepper, pomegranate and red currant come together on the nose, with elusive hints of vanilla. Acidity is lazy on the palate that combines notes of apple, blueberry and blackberry, joined by savory herbs and vanilla. A final sweep of black pepper and baked plum bring it to a close.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Early Mountain 2017 Quaker Run Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: From cool-climate sites, this has an herbal personality true to the variety, with light, bright layers of plum, raspberry and sage. The tannins are well tamed and integrated, the oak neutral.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Delta 2018 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Notes of cranberry, bruised plums and barnyard have a spicy kick on the nose. The palate combines sweet confected plum and tart cranberry, with thyme and vanilla. An unusual bitter note creeps in on the finish with a sprinkle of black pepper.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Wessex Hundred Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: A sharp nose combines red apple, plum and acetone, rosemary and vanilla notes are reveled with air. The palate is tart in flavors of cherry, red apple and crunchy cranberry. Light velvety tannins help to temper the acidity that had run wild, but seem to resolve on the round plum-flavored finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: White Hall 2017 Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Agrelo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of blueberry and black currant are focused yet intense on the nose. The saturated palate brings dark plum and light herbal flavors that only improve with airing before finishing on a lingering note of mint. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lamadrid 2017 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very fresh wine from an appellation that's often much heavier and extracted. Aromas of roasted strawberries, oak, tarragon and peppercorn confirm the grape variety, while the palate shows hibiscus, roasted red cherries and more cracked pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fallbrook 2016 33 Degrees North Gracie Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (South Coast)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: An intense black color is telling, as are aromas of blackberry, olive and charcoal. A giant palate is plush and tannic, while black fruit flavors explode alongside chocolate and toast. This is an excellent modern Cab Franc from Argentina and an example of why wineries like Norton are giving the grape its due. Drink through 2029.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2017 Altura Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This rich, structured wine captures dense smoky fruits and red-berry flavors. Aged in wood, it has a smooth texture to go with the ripe fruitiness. Balancing acidity gives this rich wine a fresh touch and some stalkiness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Batellerie 2015 Cuvée Parcellaire  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: After three years' aging, this wine has matured. Ripe, black-fruit flavors combine with smooth tannins from the wood aging and a touch of Cabernet Franc smokiness. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2016 Improvisation  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: With some wood aging, this wine is ripe and smoothly textured. Acidity balances the red-berry fruits to give freshness. After four years, the wine is ready to drink, keeping fruit while also hinting at maturity.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fabien Duveau 2015 Clos de la Côte  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and fruity on the nose at first, with red plum and ripe strawberries, this bottling grows more elegant with time, showing dried flowers and minty herbs. The palate combines black plum with tarragon and dried violets.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Marco Lucchesi 2016 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of black coffee and graphite veil the fruit on the nose of this massive Cab Franc. The palate shows a dark fruit expression alongside toasty oak and espresso accents that transition to chocolate on the finish. Drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2016 Particular Family Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Dense, young, packed with fruit, tannins and smoky flavors, this wine has good potential. Red-berry fruits are coming out of their tannins to show a fresh side to the wine. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Puy 2018  Chinon

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A ripe, smoothly textured wine, this has hints of maturity with smokiness and truffle flavors. The acidity is now fully integrated into the fruit and the structure. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Géléries 2016  Chinon

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: The distinctive smoky, stalky character of Cabernet Franc shines through this wine. Put it with the red-berry fruits and juicy acidity and the wine is balanced, structured and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Perruche 2017 Terroir de Craie  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety is unmistakable, with its notes of leaf and herb out front and coffee and chocolate in tow. Plump, pleasing fruit and barrel flavors follow. Fruit and barrel play equal parts.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusted Valley 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Appropriately herbaceous aromas meet with fresh red fruit on the nose of this bottling, which also shows rustic hints of tar. The palate offers black plum, peppercorns and more herbs, framed by sticky tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa San Juliette 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This ripe, open, smoky wine has black-currant and spice flavors to go with its lightly stalky character. Its tannins and acidity will soften to smooth this young wine's texture and make it feel richer. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal Lorieux 2017 Les Mauguerets La Contrie  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Horse Heaven Hills-located vineyard is quickly making a name for itself. Appealing aromas of green pepper, fresh tobacco, dark cherry and black currant lead to tasty, well-balanced flavors that bring a sense of purity and delicacy. A smoky finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sineann 2017 Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine displays the variety's more herbaceous side, with notes of garden herb, green pepper and green flower. The palate brings a viscous feel, with light smoky accents on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: J. Bookwalter 2016 Suspense Conner Lee Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: Still young and bursting with fruit, this wine is ripe and full of red-berry flavors. Acidity, a lightly stalky texture and smokiness give the wine a bright character. Give it a few months to soften. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2017 Concerto  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

Appellation: Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: This smoky wine is firmly structured and dense. Tannins still dominate and contrast with the red-cherry fruits and acidity that are still developing. Drink this wine with its good potential from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Géléries 2017 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Red-fruit aromas lead to a softly textured wine. With just a touch of smokiness coupled with acidity, the wine's youth is still apparent, ready to age further. The aftertaste is juicy and full of perfumed raspberry flavors. Drink from early 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fabien Duveau 2017 Origine  (Saumur-Champigny)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb, green pepper, poblano pepper, dark chocolate and spice lead to full-feeling chocolate, herb and cherry flavors. It comes off as quite green, with the oak playing a more prominent role compared with recent vintages.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2016 Katherine Corkrum Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A bone-dry, fruity wine with great acidity and a lively mousse, this 100% Cabernet Franc wine comes from Anjou. Its fruitiness, raspberry flavors and bright acidity are fully integrated and the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Landreau NV Volage Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A smoky wine with soft red-fruit flavors, this is young but perfectly ready to drink. Its acidity and fresh feel are bright, complementing the wine's fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2017 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted red cherries, dried oregano, black olive and smoky wood aromas start off this bottling. The structure is chunky with tannins, even this far into its life, and full of cherry, oak and mint flavors. It could use even more time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jason-Stephens 2014 Persing Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Reedy cherry aromas are candied and even lightly green and weedy on first take. A massive palate offers the framework for oaky flavors of baked berry and plum along with olive and peppery spice. A downshifting finish brings a mild ending to an otherwise rowdy Cabernet Franc.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2016 Obertura Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: This young wine is full of red-berry flavors. Light tannins are smoothed by ripe fruitiness and given freshness from the acidity. The wine has a dense-enough texture to be likely to age. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Daheuiller 2018  Saumur-Champigny

Appellation: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil, Loire Valley, France
Description: An open fruity wine, this is gentle with its tannins and generous with its red fruits. A touch of minerality helps the texture, giving the wine shape and density. Drink this attractive, fruity wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Berris 2017  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is an attractive, black-fruit-flavored wine. Light tannins and acidity are already well integrated and balanced with the fruits. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2018 Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of wet hay, barnyard, citrus and dried cherry are followed by tangy, slightly gritty-seeming flavors. The style seems to override the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stevens 2016 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Anjou, Loire Valley, France
Description: Some wood aging has enhanced the smooth texture of this berry-flavored wine. Hedgerow red fruits are lifted by acidity and a stalky character that leaves a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2016 La Seigneurie Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rambunctious berry-fruit aromas turn a bit murky and cheesy as this airs out. A hammering palate is jacked up and offers no respites while caramelized fiery plum flavors are medicinal, hot and merciless throughout.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Benegas 2016 Estate Wine Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Saumur, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a stalky-textured wine, with smoky flavors and plenty of young acidity. A classic Cabernet Franc from a cool vineyard, the wine conveys freshness as much as fruit. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vignes Biches 2017 La Sicadière  (Saumur)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With almost all of the fruit coming from Tudor Hills Vineyard, this is 100% varietal, though the variety seems hard to find. The aromas bring unusual, somewhat off-putting notes of soil, espresso bean, dried orange rind and cherry. The coffee flavors start out full and then taper toward the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2016 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Jeff Grier. This smells young and firm currently, with intense yet tight aromas of spiced plum, blackberry and mulberry. Additional scents of cigar box, cedar, leather and tobacco dance atop the fruity core. The mouthfeel is bold, concentrated and structured, with firm tannins that provide a strong structure and notes of cassis and black plum with a peppery, charred kick that carry through to the enduring close. It's a concentrated and well-formed wine, with a lot of longevity ahead of it. Best after 2024 and through 2034.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Villiera 2017 Cape Winemakers Guild Drip Barrel Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Burgenland, Austria
Description: Cinnamon and dill on the nose announce oak. The palate carries these over to frame tart and vivid red cherry. The body is light, crunchy and red-fruited, but for now the cinnamon overwhelms all. Fine tannins coat the tongue, and the dry finish rings with spice.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schreiner Bioweingut 2015 Confidentia Cabernet Franc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Toast, dried cherry, cassis, licorice and herb aromas are out front, bringing appeal. Well-balanced, fresh-seeming fruit and barrel flavors follow, carrying through the warm finish. The tannins give a firm squeeze, needing time to soften. The balance kicks it up a notch.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Swiftwater 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pale salmon in the glass, this rosé dazzles in well-concentrated aromas of crushed stone, wild strawberry and peppery spice. There's a pleasing ripeness to the fruit on the palate, with candied watermelon adding to the mix, yet it's all honed by tangy elements of limestone and bright acidity. A soft framing of tannins lends structure to the whole, providing enough heft for it to hold up well at the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Anthony Road 2018 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The 20% new French oak used in this bottling shows strongly on the nose, with roasted wood aromas overcoming the dark-red-cherry and light pepper scents. The palate is wrapped in firm oaky tannins, so more time will be needed to allow the smashed cherry and berry flavors to integrate with the vanilla elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Valley View Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light and fresh aromas of strawberry, cracked pepper, seared chiles and crushed slate make for a classic nose on this bottling. The palate snaps with freshness, delivering full flavors of pencil shavings, seared red pepper and smoky red fruits.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Oak Mountain 2016 Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of vanilla, cherry, herbs and baking spices, mixing equal parts fruit and barrel. Ripe, plump but light fruit flavors follow. It doesn't entirely hold together throughout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Januik 2016 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Heightened aromas of bittersweet chocolate, dried and fresh herbs, black currant, dried cranberry, flower and Twizzler are out front. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors in equal parts, with the fruit seeming a bit dried out. A lick of firm tannins ties it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pondera 2015 Reserve Stillwater Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are reticent out of the gate, with notes of spice, blue fruit, dried herbs and a whiff of smoke. Elegant fruit flavors follow, focused in the middle. It's well-constructed.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stateland 2017 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pale-pink in color, this single-variety rosé offers underripe strawberry and raspberry aromas on the nose, with accents of wet stone and peppery spice. The light-bodied palate is silken in feel and rounded out by tart red-fruit flavors that are bolstered by pulsing acidity. While lightly concentrated in flavor, it is quite enjoyable and well balanced.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2018 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Summit View, Dugger Creek and Water vineyard fruit, alluring aromas of green, savory herbs, dusty cherry, dark chocolate and earth lead to light, elegant fruit and savory flavors. The concentration doesn't seem to be all there, but what is delights, showing a lovely sense of elegance and balance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2015 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy boysenberry meets with packed purple flowers on the mellow nose of this bottling. The palate is very tangy with balsamic blackberry flavors as well as peppery spices and dried herbs on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vincent 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Umbria, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This Cabernet Franc opens with aromas of bell pepper, roasted coffee bean and dark-skinned fruit. It's medium-bodied, offering black currant jam, espresso and sage alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo e Noemia D'Amico 2014 Atlante Cabernet Franc (Umbria)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of campfire, mesquite, herbs, mushroom and red cherry lead to medium-bodied, fresh-seeming fruit flavors. Smoky accents follow. It brings a lovely sense of styling.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cor Cellars 2017 Alder Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pale-peachy-pink in color, this rosé offers a medium intensity of spiced strawberry, melon and chamomile on the nose. The palate is light in profile, with tart strawberry hull and lemon flavors. It's brisk and clean, with a short yet enjoyable finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2018 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dried orange peel and tobacco notes lead to supple, light plum and orange peel flavors. The extraction seems dialed back and the variety hard to find.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: College Cellars 2016 Clarke Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not entirely harmonious dark chocolate, butterscotch and sour aromas lead to somewhat lighter styled fruit flavors. A quite warm finish follows. It pushes the boundaries of overripeness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lord Lion 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A beautiful shade of watermelon-pink, this rosé starts off with notes of crushed peppercorn and jalapeño. The palate is equally green and herbaceous, with tangy slicks of wet stone alongside flavors of strawberry and watermelon.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2018 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Handsome and full bodied, this wine packs plenty of dark-fruit flavors along with enticing accents of cedar, tobacco and vanilla. It has a broad and chewy texture that supports the opulent flavors very nicely and keeps the momentum going through the lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: This wine spent a full 24 months in barrel and strong scents and flavors of baking spices currently dominate the black fruits. There's also a big blast of smoke, char, graphite and roasted coffee. It's a stylistic choice that will please many palates, and will benefit from decanting. Drink 2020–2028.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Township 7 2016 Cabernet Franc (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark blue-black in hue, this was aged for 22 months in neutral oak. A touch of spice adds a note of definition to what is largely a simple, black-fruited red wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2016 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine offers a burnt rubber flavor that shoots through the heart of the black fruits. The fruit struggles to shine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cliff Creek 2013 Sams Valley Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a rich yet varietally correct expression of Cabernet Franc, beginning with aromas of strawberry syrup, licorice, burned coffee, peppercorn and a hint of pyrazine via the oregano. The palate shows more green elements such as fresh herbs and pasilla chile, against a roasted berry backdrop.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brick Barn 2016 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Spicy, earthy berry aromas are at the foundation of a dry, elegant nose that isn't just extracted and heavy. A balanced palate is fleshy and fruity, with flavors of baked plum and spiced blackberry. On the finish, this Cabernet Franc is dense, chocolaty, well oaked and spicy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maquis 2015 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright boysenberry aromas mix with white-pepper and forest-floor elements on the nose of this bottling, which shows strong varietal characteristics. It lands on the palate with rich black-plum flavors that are quickly cut by green peppercorn, Japanese sansho pepper and minty herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rotta 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Compact aromas are meaty and spicy and settle on blackberry once the nose airs out. A full palate with chewy tannins is rock solid and grabby. Spiced plum and cherry flavors have a baked quality, while this is integrated and tastes of oak, baking spices and cinnamon on the finish. All in all, this is a terrific value-priced Cab Franc.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Calcu 2015 Reserva Especial Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a Cabernet Franc-driven wine, blended with 5% Merlot, all estate-grown grapes. It opens in a robust nose of black currant, graham cracker and dried herb, the tannins chalky and firm. There's a touch of reduction that suggests further opening or cellaring; enjoy best from 2024–2031.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jarvis 2014 Will Jarvis' Science Project Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe red-cherry aromas meet with light mint and cigar box on the nose of this bottling. The fresh, acid-washed palate is quite broad with red currant and tangy red plum, lifted with hints of bay leaf and finishing on a caramel streak.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brecon Estate 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Floral plum and grainy oak aromas result in a nose that's fruity but also a bit lactic. Layered tannins make for a tough mouthfeel, while this Cab Franc tastes of plum, currant, wood spice, butter and vanilla. A dry finish is tannic and scratchy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maquis 2016 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of red fruit and herbs are energetic on the nose, while flavors of pomegranate, raspberry and rhubarb pop on the palate. Fresh, juicy acidity and a chalky mineral mouthfeel add intrigue and carry the intense flavors on the finish.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Lightwell Survey 2016 The Weird Ones are Wolves Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: The wine is deep ruby accented with a bright magenta rim. Raspberry and black plum aromas are ripe, with vanilla, sage, thyme and peppercorns on the nose. Ripe red plum and cherry flavors are juicy on this sleek velvety wine, with bay leaf and sage (touched by vanilla bean) playing a supporting roll. The finish is spicy and laced with red currant.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Mari 2017 Jamieson Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Sagrada Familia, Chile
Description: Savory almost soupy aromas of earthy plum and currant are initially gaseous. This Cab Franc feels blocky, with edgy tannins creating a grabby palate. Spiced plum flavors fade out on a finish with buttery oak notes. This is a very good red wine, but does it offer anything that distinguishes it as Cab Franc? You be the judge.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valdivieso 2014 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sagrada Familia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit seems a bit desiccated on the aromas, with notes of dried cherry along with licorice, graphite and herb. The palate has a pleasing sense of structure, but the aromas and palate don't seem to line up. Dried fruit notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mosquito Fleet 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Leelanau Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: This opens with a surprising aroma of Swedish Fish leading to cocoa powder, goji berry, fresh cranberry and white pepper. Juicy fruit notes take the lead on the soft textured palate, with cherry, raspberry and strawberry joined by bay leaves, thyme and dried tobacco. The tannins are fine grained while the acidity is boisterous. The finish has a peppery kick that lingers with dried herbs and lingonberry.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Shady Lane 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Leelanau Peninsula)

Appellation: Curicó Valley, Chile
Description: Grassy, green aromas of clover patch and earthy berry fruit are fitting for a wine from a hot year with an early harvest. A capped, resiny palate is tough and tannic, while this tastes of savory blackberry, rubber and plenty of oak. A bone-dry, scratchy finish is rough on the cheeks.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Junta 2017 Gran Reserva Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Vanilla bean, blackberry and bramble berry aromas are teased by star anise on the nose. The smooth palate is juicy with acidity and flavors of cranberry, raspberry and plum. Crushed velvet tannins add depth along with flavors of kitchen herbs, a sprinkle of pepper and a drop of vanilla. Baking spice appears on the finish ending on a savory note with red plum.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Bonobo 2017 Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of cranberry, peppercorns, dried mints and a hint of strawberry. It's crisp with cranberry and pomegranate on the palate, which is very fresh and clean and lifted by thyme and sagebrush.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (San Diego County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an attractive, rich and easy-drinking wine that tops nice ripe berry and cherry flavors with ample oak spices. It is medium- to full-bodied and has light tannins for just a bit of grip in the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Spann Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Franc (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Blueberry, violet and lavender sing on the nose of this Cabernet Franc. It's more brambly on the palate, along with a funky, earthy note. Firm tannins and juicy acidity are well integrated and give it a sumptuous mouthfeel.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Early Mountain 2017 Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Leafy green herb, green pepper, mocha, barrel spice and ash aromas lead to full feeling fruit, herb and dark chocolate flavors. It might be a bit green for some tastes, even for the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Grand River Valley, Ohio, US
Description: The wine is ruby-red and very opaque with a thin magenta rim in the glass. Dried cranberry, blueberry and chocolate-malt balls are a little sharp on the nose, with a hint of asphalt. Showing flavors of blackberry, cigar box, vanilla and tobacco, firm gritty tannins grip the tongue on the palate while acidity dances around them looking for an opening. Tannins grip through the finish, with a mouthpuckering peppery spice and black cherry.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Laurentia 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Grand River Valley)

Appellation: Lake Michigan Shore, Michigan, US
Description: Animal hide, jammy black cherry, cedar and cocoa powder mark the foxy and funky nose. Slinky acidity and light fine tannins offer structure and support creating a smooth palate feel. Bright fruit notes of red cherry, red plum and cranberry are stalked by vanilla leading to a oaky vanilla finish that integrates nicely with the fruit flavors.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Dablon 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake Michigan Shore)

Appellation: Leelanau Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Aromas of milk chocolate, dark berry, nutmeg and coffee grounds define the nose. Bright acidity bolsters cherry and pomegranate flavors, while vanilla, charred oak and cedar settle into the fine dusty tannins. The finish is spicy with lingering black cherry and a touch of cumin.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Boathouse Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Franc (Leelanau Peninsula)

Appellation: Michigan, Michigan, US
Description: Black currant, black berry and black cherry aromas duel with green chili and bell pepper on the nose. The black fruits carry over to the moderately concentrated palate along with green tobacco leaf. Lean acidity and powdery tannins offer support.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Black Star Farms 2016 Arcturos Cabernet Franc (Michigan)

Appellation: Old Mission Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Cranberry, cedar and licorice are sharp and spicy on the nose of this Cabernet Franc that spent 18 months in oak. Tart cherry and cranberry flavors introduce the palate and are paired with anise and nutmeg. Ultrafirm fine grained tannins frame the structure, while broad swaths of acidity provide relief. The fruit darkens on the finish, joined by peppery spice.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Bowers Harbor 2016 Erica Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of blueberry pie, cocoa nib and cherry cola come through on the nose. The palate leans towards a grapey tone that's tinged with oak spice. This is easy in feel and a good choice for a casual glass.                      Carrie Dykes
Name: Veramar 2017 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Leelanau Peninsula, Michigan, US
Description: Boysenberry, goji berry and anise aromas are tainted by shoe polish on the nose. The acidity is high toned and tannins are sandy on a palate displaying cranberry, black-currant and creosote flavors. The finish offers bitter resin and raspberry.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Aurora 2016 Cabernet Franc (Leelanau Peninsula)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil and resinous herbs immediately entice, with a dense core of dark cherry and red plum offering solid base notes. There's real presence and intensity to the palate, displaying powerful waves of thick-skinned berry flavors that come with grip and persistence, but not overbearingly so. A granite twang and more earth tones linger on the finish. Drink now–2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A generous helping of spicy, smoky oak blends with a rich and saturated black fruit flavor in this full-bodied, moderately tannic and seductive wine. Aged in 30% new American and French barrels, it offers layers of flavor, a good sense of depth and plenty of structure for pairing with big proteins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of tilled earth, pink peppercorn, juniper and tart berries carry the nose of this wine. There's a pleasing density to these tones on the medium-bodied palate, bolstered by bouncy acidity and ripe tannins. Plenty of herbal and earthy nuances persist through the lengthy finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Atlantida, Uruguay
Description: Complex aromas of sandalwood, baking spices and berry fruits are entirely convincing. This Cab Franc feels fleshy, while firm tannins make the palate crunchy and far from soft. Savory, spicy plum flavors finish with mild notes of oak but nothing that suggests woodiness. Drink through 2021.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bracco Bosca 2017 Gran Ombú Cabernet Franc (Atlantida)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: This single-block Cab Franc opens with herbal aromas of leafy plum and berry fruits. A full, rounded palate holds flavors of coffee, plum, basil and game. There's plenty of heft and texture to this wine, but soft tannins and full ripeness make it ready to drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Garzón 2016 Petit Clos Block #127 Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A dense nose of dark bramble berry and black berry offers a brooding start, with accents of peppercorn, herbs and iodine adding interest. This is well-concentrated on the medium-bodied palate in dark, thick-skinned berry flavors that sit on a silken texture. A healthy grip of tannins and plenty of peppery spice provide a beautiful counterbalance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Shalestone 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The mountainous terrain keeps this bottling on the lighter red-fruit side of the grape, offering aromas of tart cranberry, rose petals, wet gravel and a hint of oaky vanilla. The palate is fresh with pomegranate, raspberry jam and tart red plum, spiced by white pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2015 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While closed at first on the nose, this unoaked Cabernet Franc eventually opens up to a pretty array of red fruit, floral and peppery spice aromas. The palate is rounded and juicy in feel, with soft tannins that offer a perfect match to the smooth, well-structured body. Loads of mixed berry flavors abound throughout the midpalate, with white pepper lingering on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2017 Estate Bottled T23 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a soothing nature to the bouquet of this wine, with well-formed aromas of cherry and cranberry that meld with shades of fresh herbs, delicate black pepper and blood-orange zest. The medium-bodied palate is rounded and smooth in sinewy tannins yet pleasantly vibrant in acidity, displaying vibrant red-berry and herbal flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now–2022.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Macari 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While initially closed on the nose, with time in the glass this wine reveals delightful aromas of dark cherry and mulling spice. The palate steals the show with its silken, rounded feel that supports boisterous red-berry flavors that are honed by a crunchy, chalky texture on the midpalate. Lifted tones of violet and tilled earth arise on the finish. Drink now.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paumanok 2015 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Blended with 25% Merlot, this wine offers a mix of black- and red-berry aromas on the nose, with hints of peppercorn, tilled earth and a sanguine tone. It offers a persistent, juicy core of thick-skinned berries, with a slick of granite and tangy acidity. The tannins are light yet peppery, offering the perfect amount of support for easy enjoyment in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Boundary Breaks 2017 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from a specific block in the winery's estate vineyards, this red delights on the nose in aromas of cranberry and strawberry, with shades of green-tobacco leaf and peppercorn. The medium-bodied palate has an almost silken feel from the smooth tannins, while plenty of acidity props up the fresh pomegranate and cranberry flavors. A tangy grip of granite and pink peppercorn lingers on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2016 North Block Six Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is full-bodied, firmly tannic and saturated with cranberry and black-cherry flavors. It's a bold and structured wine that needs rich food as a pairing to really show its stuff, or a few more years of storage in a cool place. Best after 2022.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Writer's Block 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from vines planted in 2005 at the winery's organically farmed vineyard on the north shore of Lake Chelan, an area that has a geology distinct from the rest of the broader Columbia Valley. Unique aromas of porcini mushroom, peat, tobacco, cherry and crushed gravel lead to well-balanced fruit flavors that have a seamless feel. Many Lake Chelan wines show the area's promise. This wine delivers.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Burning Desire Estate Glacier Gravels Vineyard
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2016 Burning Desire Estate Glacier Gravels Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Initially closed on the nose, with a few swirls in the glass this reveals notes of thick-skinned blackberry and peppery spice. There's a pleasing grip of chalky tannins to the entry of the palate, yet plenty of dark berry flavors fill it out, giving way to green herbs and peppery spice on the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2015 Proprietor's Special Reserve Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy tobacco and clove greet the entry of this balanced, light-bodied wine. Dark cherry, plum and dried herb round out the nuanced experience that is supported by firm, persistent tannins.                      Virginie Boone
Name: T. Berkley Wines 2016 Leaning Oak Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A bright streak of graphite starts off the nose of this wine, leading to a vibrant core of cranberry, cherry and peppery spice. The medium-bodied palate is rounded out by succulent red-fruit flavors, with a granite twang offering a tangy counterweight. Crisp tones of black peppercorn and graphite rise up on the finish to give a final burst of flavor to this enjoyable wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Maldonado, Uruguay
Description: Mature aromas of tobacco, vanilla, baking spices and earthy berry fruits are similar to classic Spanish Tempranillo. A slightly tannic palate without a lot in the midsection offers berry, spice and vanilla flavors in front of a dry finish. Call this high-quality Cab Franc “Old World” in style. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alto de la Ballena 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Maldonado)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark fruits of elderberry and black plum meet with loamy soil, gravel and black pepper on the nose of this bottling from a mostly dry-farmed vineyard. The palate offers blackberry and toasted oak spice, leaning toward a richer expression of the variety.                      Matt Kettmann
