Name: Foxen 7200 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty floral and pink peppercorn aromas start off this light-bodied red, with shades of fresh green herbs riding over a core of high-toned cranberry and currant. The palate brings a slim profile of tart red-fruit flavors, with a savory granite twang creeping up on the midpalate and feather-light tannins offering support. It was sourced from Sawmill Creek Vineyard on the east side of Seneca Lake and aged in large-format French barrels (50% new) for eight months.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Osmote 2017 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gorgeous, uncomplicated fruit flavors give this wine loads of appeal. It shows fresh red cherry and black cherry on the nose, delicious cherry and blackberry on the palate and a lightly firm texture for good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Boeger 2016 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a light-bodied Cabernet Franc that offers tones of spiced currant and cranberry on the nose and palate, with a delicate framing of green herbs. It is carried by juicy acidity and a line of fine-grained tannins that meld with the tart red-fruit flavors. Drink now for its immediate appeal.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of pomegranate, cranberry and fresh thyme show bright and intense on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is juicy in a red-fruit character that's propped up by floral pink peppercorns, while a veil of tannins and persistent acidity offer support. Drink with a slight chill to enjoy the delicious, tangy fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Initial aromas of strawberry and crushed herb mark the nose, with tones of geranium, peppery spice and tilled earth providing depth. The medium-bodied palate is rounded out by luscious red-berry flavors, cut by a streak of bitter greens and propped up by a delicate frame of tannins. More earthy tones linger on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hound's Tree 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Boisterous aromas of ripe red cherry and pink peppercorn dazzle on the nose. There's a pleasing roundness to the light-bodied palate, with a grainy grip of tannins and tangy acidity propelling the bouncy red-berry flavor. Specks of black pepper and green herbs give a little heft to this easy-drinking red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hickory Hollow 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sheens of oak, coffee and baking spice mark the nose, with the palate offering more fruit in the way of plump dark cherry and blackberry. The tannins have a slight bitter edge, and the acidity is currently a bit biting, but there's plenty of density to the fruit flavors for this to come together in a few years. Drink from 2020.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2015 Caya Cabernet Franc (Long Island)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: There's a slightly gamy, meaty character upfront on the nose of this wine, with bold, black fruit tones to add support. Touches of green pepper, tobacco and tea add interest, as well as a hint of fresh coffee grinds. Plush and velvety in feel, it shows good structure and tannins, with lush black-fruit tones that ground the palate and ride through to the medium-length finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Designation: Le Jardins de Vignes Rares de Ciceron Le
Name: Les Domaines Auriol Claude Vialade 2016 Le Jardins de Vignes Rares de Ciceron Le Cabernet Franc (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Initially reserved on the nose, with a few swirls in the glass this red reveals high-toned aromas of red berries and violet. The medium bodied palate is plush and ripe in cranberry and cherry flavors, with soft tannins and mellow acidity providing the framework.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Damiani 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of violets, crushed vitamins and cumin ride over a rubbery berry core in this red. On the palate, tangy cranberry and zesty granite start off a river of flavors, with an earthy lentil note coming in on the midpalate. The tannins are a bit grainy and green, but overall this shows good structure with proper fruit to balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fox Run 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Spicy, herbal aromas of tomato sauce, basil, coffee grounds and plum lead to a medium-depth palate with edginess and chop. Spiced berry flavors are slightly green and accented by oaky clove, while this Cab Franc is dry and drawing on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Garzón 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Uruguay)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of crushed tarragon and oregano ride over a core of spiced cranberry on the nose. There's good roundness to the entry on the palate, with cherry and cranberry flavors speckled with shades of baking spices. The tannins are a bit big on the finish, with some bitterness, but overall this is shows good balance and easy drinkability.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is mellow, mature and smooth, showing nicely developed oak, spice and leather characteristics and a palate-pleasing, mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Campos 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big in flavor but smooth in texture, this hearty wine accents blackberry and black-cherry flavors with light smoky spicy notes. It is light in tannin, has a mouthfilling presence and touches of vanilla on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Langman Estate 2016 Estate Reserve William's Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of cranberry and raspberry take on a slight confected note, but are rounded out by savory tones of game and peppercorn. The medium-bodied palate is tartly red-fruit focused, with bright shots of acidity that highlight tones of peppery spice and green herbs. There's a lot of verve and vitality to this wine, with everything mostly in balance, but there's a slightly bitter green note on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fjord 2015 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A white wine, made as a Blanc de Noirs from Cabernet Franc, this is fruity, crisp with melon and quince flavors. It is textured, hinting at tannins as well as having a pure acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2017 Blanc de Franc Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Sharp aromas of green herbs and brimstone turn more soft on the palate, where crunchy raspberry and cranberry reside. This is light in feel yet supported by a grip of tannins that props up the juicy red-berry flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Robibero 2013 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A savory aroma of chicken broth starts this off, with cherry and cranberry coming in after a bit of swirling in the glass. The palate is rounded and soft in a ripe red-berry flavor, with bits of savory spice and herb. It lacks in verve and life, but it will definitely please a crowd.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Warming notes of vanilla and rooibos ride over a core of liquor-soaked tart berries on the nose. The palate is light in feel, with a slick streak of racy acidity that carries flavors of tart red berries, black pepper and green herbs. Grainy tannins and a sweet vanilla note linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: O-Neh-Da 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Light raspberry and cranberry tones meld with loads of green-tobacco leaf and pepper on the nose of this single-vineyard offering. The palate is straightforward in profile, with light tannins and slightly insipid acidity offering support to the red-berry and herbal flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Richmond Creek Vineyard Estate Grown Unfiltered
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2014 Richmond Creek Vineyard Estate Grown Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A high-toned nail-polish note rides over subtle tones of cranberry and baking spice. There's a bit of roundness on the palate, yet sharp acidity cuts in giving it light delicate feel overall.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Whitecliff Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Franc (New York)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of cherry and spiced raspberry meld with shards of tobacco leaf and pink peppercorn on the nose. The palate is lithe and linear in feel, with light impressions of red fruit that are dusted with green-leaf notes.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of bubblegum spice and cinnamon mix with cherry on the nose of this easygoing red. It is medium bodied and rounded in feel, filled with plump red-fruit flavors and peppery spice. Medium-grained tannins carry a bit of bitterness, with mild acidity offering support.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tousey 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Oaky notes of coconut and vanilla start out on the nose and carry to the medium-bodied palate. There are delicious, crunchy cranberries and cherries hiding beneath, but ultimately the wood tones overpower come the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of game, Band-Aid, baking spice and cherry are followed by tart, puckering fruit flavors. The tannins bring a gritty feel. The variety seems hard to find.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Nirvana Wines 2016 Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This unoaked Cabernet Franc offers an incredibly herbal nose of serrano chili and Tabasco sauce. The light-bodied palate offers tart red-fruit flavors and more herbal twang, with tight, drying tannins pushing through the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fox Run 2017 Ikehu Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Description: A very beautiful shade of pink, this bottling is a bit funky throughout, starting with aromas of caked earth and cold metal. The palate shows a decent tension, yet the flavors of dried fruit and damp herbs aren't typical for a rosé.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2018 M Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Temecula)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are off, with volatile notes along with green pepper and game lurking in the background. The palate is light and elegant, showing a pleasant sense of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cathedral Ridge 2016 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Chinon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Top of the range from this producer, this complex, dense wine is still packed with young, developing tannins. Two years in wood enhances the smoky character. The rich structure, black fruits and concentration all show this wine will age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bernard Baudry 2016 La Croix Boissée  (Chinon)

Appellation: Saumur-Champigny, Loire Valley, France
Description: Sourced from a vineyard at the highest point of the appellation, close to the village of Dampierre, this is a serious, concentrated wine. It's dense, with layers of black cherry fruits, rich tannins and acidity. Wood-aged in massive 660-gallon barrels, it has a firm structure, which will allow it to age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Les Mémoires  (Saumur-Champigny)
